updates.update_content:
Dear friends,
You might be asking yourselves, where in the world are the @laborcamp COVID-19 Labor Camp Report books? Right now they are in the North-East  Atlantic Ocean (coordinates 42.19529 N / 11.71131 W) on their way to St. John. If you have been following along with our journey, you may have noticed that while en route our shipping container changed hands! The ship went from being the CHARLESTON EXPRESS to the VELIKA EXPRESS, now sailing under the Liberian flag. Thanks to a @laborcamp friend, we can see this amazing image of the ship’s name being repainted!  We estimate arrival in St. John in four days and books onsite in Minneapolis by July 20. Onward we voyage!

updates.update_userinfo: LAST chance to change your address!
The cover, the future, and the surprise
updates.update_content: Here it is, finally, we can share it, the cover of Piotr Szyhlaski / Labor Camp's  (IG @laborcamp) “COVID-19: Labor Camp Report” book. The book is in production with the printer and although we are more than eager to confirm the official shipping timeline with you all, we don’t have the exact date yet but promise to share it with you once we do, very soon.

Dear friends,
We love revisiting the 225 posts of his COVID-19: Labor Camp Report drawings on Piotr Szyhalski's @laborcamp Instagram feed. Scrolling through his profile page offers an expanded view of the project that, unless you have been fortunate enough to experience one of the exhibitions of the work (like the one currently on view at MIA in Minneapolis), is the only way to experience the series from this perspective. This way of seeing opens up new relationships between the visual language and the messages within the drawings, revealing the immense generosity within the project. It also positions the work in direct relationship to time, operating like an alternative calendar for the period between March 24 and November 3, 2020. We are excited to say our book will be another space for this.

Dear friends,
Today marks the one year anniversary of the COVID-19 Labor Camp Report and Piotr decided to create a new drawing, an epilogue for the series. We wanted to share this moment with all of you and are re-posting the image from his Instagram below .

updates.update_userinfo: Hard at work & a loving reminder to fill out your survey!
updates.update_content:
Dear friends,
It has been too long since we last spoke and we hope this update finds you all safe and healthy. Time has become even more elusive and elastic these days but don't fret, we are hard at work putting the finishing touches on the book. We have constant debates about what to share and what to keep a surprise, because the delay in production has frankly enabled us to expand and stretch the book's design in a multitude of ways.  Incredible texts by Janet Abrams, Joseph del Pesco, and Colette Gaiter offer rich entry points into the work and the breath of images is a treasure trove just waiting for you to dive deep. We cannot wait for you to hold the book in your hands.

updates.update_userinfo: Slow yet Steadfast: An Updated Schedule
updates.update_content:
Dear friends,
As we write to you, we find ourselves trying to navigate the hard truths about the world we live in: ongoing inequalities made incredibly worse by the COVID-19 pandemic, a democratic system breaking apart at the seams, and a reckoning with the catastrophes heading our way if we don’t act with urgency and collective care. The events from this past year are shaping the lives we live, and frankly, the futures we will inhabit. It is our shared responsibility to look closely at where we are and how we got here, to scrutinize, ask questions, and reappraise the landscape we occupy. And if we are being honest, some days it is hard to know where to start.

Story of a creative process
I´am Vicente Molina, I´am a painter, sculptor, illustrator, I make short films and animations. I have worked as a professor at some universities and I wanted to share with you the latest work I have done. It is a Tarot deck,  that I have been working on for quite some time.
It is the result of a creative process. I do not read the Tarot. As a teacher I started to prepare a series of activities that had to do with Christian iconography. I decided to PREPARE A project that in principle was going to have educational aims. I ended up designing a tarot when I met Kikstarter.
I have practically based myself on the Tarot of Marseille and the cards of the Spanish deck. I really like Jodorowski's poetic work and I have taken many ARCANOS from his book with Marianne Costa: "The Way of the Tarot". I have also been inspired by books and YouTube channels such as Alejandra's "I want to learn Tarot.com". So if you know the Marseille and the Riders TAROT it will not be difficult for you to use this project. As an artist,  I have simply been carried away by the most interesting aspects of EACH OF THE TAROTS I HAVE CONSULTED.
There are cards in which the color reveals the aspects of the Tarot of Marseille, but that I have not used in cards that I wanted to make darker.
There is cards in which I have chosen pictorial references, for example “the chariot” has the influence of Giotto and his saint Francisco de Asis in a chariot of fire, The high Priestess reminds this Madonna of the Renaissance.
The magician's card is one of my favorites, it is the first one I designed and it is the germ of the process. MORANDI is also the name of a character that I created for my animations.
For minor arcana I have been inspired by the Spanish deck and their equivalent in the Tarot RIDER. For some cards I have chosen a relative simplicity, when I learned that “swords-cards” are generally “THOUGHTS”, I decided to make an abstraction that, for example, the mundane “COINS” do not have .
I worked with large formats and some details will not be seen in the cards, so I have prepared some postcards with details as a gift for the first sponsors to arrive.
The designs are finished digitally, the original sketches are, however, the most important part of the creative process: I attach photographs of some of these sketches that will be finished by hand at the end of the campaign.
It seems that in the end, I have completed the trip of “THE FOOL” , has been a lot of fun AND I hope you like the work and it is useful for many people.

campaign.story:
Surrealist Dinner Party is a family strategy game featuring famous figures from the Surrealism art movement! On your turn, bring new guests to the party, serve food and drink, or have guests socialize with their neighbors at the table. Each guest also has a unique ability, so pay careful attention to who is sitting next to whom! Of course you want to make all the guests you’ve invited happy, but if you can arrange for your opponents’ guests to start a little drama, that’s okay too!
It is living and ceasing to live that are imaginary solutions. Existence is elsewhere…
– André Breton
Each guest wants a unique combination of Wine, Food, Dessert, Compliments and Drama from the party. When you send a guest home, you get to move all of their matching-color tokens to your stash, and the player with the most tokens in their stash wins!
On your turn, you do one of four things: 
Seat a Guest
Serve a Guest
Compliment or Start Drama
Use Abilities
Play a guest from your hand to the table in front of you. You can only have 3 guests at once, so eventually you'll have to send some home
Give your guest one of the tokens from the platter. The platter refills with different tokens for each of the 6 courses of the game. As soon as it's empty, you move on to the next course.
Choose one of your guests and one of their neighbors, then give them each a Compliment or a Drama. Giving opponents' guests unwanted Drama is a great way to mess with them!
Every guest has a unique ability that allows them to help themself or mess with their neighbors. Some of these abilities can be used on your turn!
Want to see it played? Full playthrough video by Board Game House!
Not everything in the rulebook, print & play, and online versions of the game is final; we're still doing final balancing tweaks on the guests and their abilities, and the art and layout! The free print and play has only one guest illustration.
   NOTE: exact token counts, art, Surrealists in the game, and guest abilities pictured throughout the campaign are not final. We'll be making tweaks before release 
Want to translate the instructions into another language? Send us a message!
NOTE: Shipping is estimated, and may change depending on market rates and how many backers we get in each region. Shipping will be charged after the campaign via the pledge manager
Shipping to the US, EU, Canada, and Australia is customs-free. Mechanica and Monarch addons will cost +$5.00 to ship instead of $2.50.
Fine Print
Kickstarter Exclusivity Policy: We will never sell the Kickstarter edition of the game (the base game plus the Kickstarter specials—in this case the mystery guests and the turn marker, if unlocked) to nonbackers. Backers, including retail backers, will be able to order more while supplies last. Occasionally we might: 
Send the Kickstarter edition of the game to a reviewer
Give away a Kickstarter edition of the game on our social media channels
Make the Kickstarter edition of the game available to backers of our future campaigns
Sell or distribute the Kickstarter special components separately (like selling one of the mystery guest cards at a convention)
Cancellation Policy: You can cancel your pledge during the campaign at no charge. After the campaign, you can cancel up to 1 month before fulfillment for a 90% refund (we're not keeping 10%—that's how much Kickstarter takes as a fee). 
Late Pledge Policy: All tiered pledges will entitle backers to order more copies of the Kickstarter edition of the game while supplies last! HOWEVER: the price for games ordered after the Kickstarter may increase one month after the campaign.
Shipping Mishap Policy: We carefully monitor every backer's shipment and notify you to make sure that shipments aren't lost or returned. During the shipping period, please monitor your Kickstarter inbox for notifications about shipping problems. You will have 60 days from the shipping announcement update to let us know if your game doesn't arrive. We are committed to getting your game to you, but if there's a shipping mishap and you don't notify us within 60 days, or you don't respond to our notification, and you want us to send a replacement game, we may ask you to pay for the replacement shipping or the game itself. 
Other Regions Shipping Policy: Some countries in our "Other Regions" shipping area can be risky to ship to. If your package is lost after arriving in your country and you want us to send a replacement, we may ask you to pay for the replacement shipping or the game itself.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Stronghold Games has learned how to streamline the game publishing process and has successfully delivered games to thousands of its supporters. Our previous experiences will enable us to also deliver this project on time and we have every confidence that Terraforming Mars: Big Box will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Stronghold Games will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus 20% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.
This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

DAMAGED OR INCOMPLETE PRODUCTS

We understand that all backers want to receive their items in pristine condition; however, the realities of worldwide shipping can sometimes make this difficult. We guarantee that the product you receive will be complete and all internal components in perfect condition. We will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in good condition, but all decisions on box replacements will be made on a case by case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense in replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace some boxes with minor cosmetic damage only.

RETURNED PRODUCTS

If you refuse to accept your package on arrival we will not issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge.

FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY

Surveys will be completed through Crowd Ox. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you by up to a few months. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (ie, provide us with your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

updates.update_content:
Executives,
We’re here with another update about the rolling fulfillment for your pledges. We’re nearing the end, and have hope that you’ll all see your games in the next few weeks! 
Regional Shipping Updates:

Hello terraformers,
I come bearing news! Everything is moving along, and orders are being shipped out all over the world. Overall, this massive undertaking of fulfillment is going well, but not without some issues. You can find more detailed information about your region's fulfillment below. Rolling fulfillment is a long process as we can’t ship orders for which the component pieces haven’t arrived. We appreciate your patience - overall, we’re in the middle of a month-long process. Even without a rolling fulfillment, this was a huge project that would take weeks to complete. And remember, we don’t like this rolling fulfillment any more than you do - but the sheer scope of the project (over 11 containers of games), and the vast, ongoing supply chain issues caused by COVID made it the best way to get games to you. But even if it is the best way, it certainly is showing the ugly side of the freight game that backers usually don’t see. The fact that so much progress has been made means our fulfillment centers are showing off their work ethic!

Hello executives,
I’m back only a week later with exciting news. As you may have noticed, some of you have started getting shipping notifications - and we are super excited about that! Let’s break down exactly what that means, and again ask for everyone’s patience as this is going to be a rolling fulfillment over the course of a month.
First, some (but not all!) of the containers arrived at each of the different fulfillment centers. Our great partners have been super busy unloading the containers and getting packages started on their way to you without delay - this is the fastest turnaround time we have ever had between containers arriving and packages leaving the warehouse.  Since there are so many packages in these containers, we need to make sure there is a constant flow out so that the fulfillment centers don’t run out of room when new containers come in - which is a big reason why we are doing a rolling fulfilment rather than waiting for all the containers to arrive and then starting the shipments.

Hey backers time for a brief update!
Please remember this is a huge fulfilment project – in total there are 10 full containers for backer rewards, in the middle of a global pandemic that has had significant effects on freight. For many reasons we are doing a rolling fulfillment process ( meaning we send out rewards as we receive them in the fulfillment warehouses, not wait for everything to arrive) with a number of our other projects that are shipping from China around the same time. That means some packages will go out much sooner than others, possibly greater than a month difference between people with the same orders.

campaign.story:
THE SHORT STORY:
Thought-Forms: A Record of Clairvoyant Investigation is a seminal occult book compiled by the leaders of the Theosophical Society, Annie Besant and C. W. Leadbeater. It was originally published in 1905 in London. According to the teachings of Theosophy, thoughts and emotions create distinctive patterns of color and form in the human aura—visible only to those who are gifted with a sufficient degree of clairvoyance and can see beyond our normal perceptions. Besant and Leadbeater dictated their clairvoyant "thought-forms" to a group of friends who then created the 58 magnificent illustrations contained in the book. This book was a major influence on the artists Hilma Af Klint and Wassily Kandinsky among many others but has long been overlooked as a foundational pillar in art history. 
Besant was also an early suffragist and political activist and was far ahead of her time as an artist and thinker. Theosophy was the first occult group to open its doors to women and Thought Forms offers a reminder that the history of modernist abstraction and women’s contribution to it is still being written.
A proper, color corrected version of the book is not currently in print. Our re-print aims to bring this over looked masterpiece back into circulation in the form of a high quality clothbound and embossed hardcover at an affordable price. We have also worked with the editor of the project Lucy Lord Campana to commission three introductory pieces by contemporary scholars to further contextualize the book. 
At a Funeral
THE LONG STORY: 
Thought-Forms: A Record of Clairvoyant Investigation by Annie Besant and Charles W. Leadbeater originally published in 1905, is a 143 page, illustrated book that offers a look into a chapter of the past that has largely been forgotten.
Besant and Leadbeater were the third wave leaders of the Theosophical Society. Theosophy is an occult movement founded in New York City in the late 1800s. It was a time when ideas about individuality, religion, art and science were up in the air as the structures of society were shifting. The aim of Theosophy was to unify all religions, create world peace and further the “unlimited capacities of man”, proclaiming that “there is no religion higher than truth”.
Annie Besant was a British socialist, women's rights activist, anti-colonialist, and pro-union fighter whose spiritual journey eventually led her to Theosophy. She fought for birth control, and was arrested when she put out a book on family planning. Besant's close collaborator in the Theosophical movement was C. W. Leadbeater, to whom she credited as helping her gain clairvoyance. Together they wrote about topics such as the human aura, the history of mankind, and the chemical structure of the universe.
According to the teachings of Theosophy, thoughts and emotions create distinctive patterns of color and form in the human aura—visible only to those who are gifted with a sufficient degree of clairvoyance and can see beyond our normal perceptions. The quality of thought determines the aura’s color and shape; a person who is selfless and generous, possesses an aura that is radiant and clear; for those who are selfish and insensitive—their aura is cloudy and muddy. These artist impressions were made available only in Thought Forms and are radically different than anything else made at that time.
We learned of Thought Forms a few years ago and it completely took us by surprise. This one book totally challenged the classic art history narrative that had been taught to in school. Not like we fundamentally believed that story, abstraction is found in all cultures—not just in western 20th century painting, but the genesis story of a few male painters “inventing” abstraction does have its truths.
In this narrative of Modernism, Vassily Kandinsky is widely viewed as one of the most important founders of abstraction, and his manifesto On the Spiritual in Art is mandatory reading in art school.
What was never mentioned to us in school however, was that Kandinsky was a member of the Theosophical Society, and had acquired a copy of their book Thought Forms a few years before he abandoned conventional ways of painting. Learning that Kandinsky didn’t just come upon these ideas on his own as previously thought, totally changed our understanding of his work. It’s worth mentioning that Piet Mondrian was also deeply influenced by Theosophy and later on, Jackson Pollock was as well.
Last year the Guggenheim held the first US retrospective of Hilma af Klint’s paintings. She was a member of the Theosophical Society and was undoubtably influenced by the spiritualistic currents of the time. Theosophy was the first occult group to open its doors to women, and it deeply questioned gender roles, many of these ideas are also in Af Klint’s paintings. This show was one of the first times the all-male origin story of abstraction was challenged within the ivory tower. Af Klint, made these paintings before Kandinsky, and she was a woman. Thought Forms came out before Af Klint began her abstract paintings and it is certain that she must have come across this book.
We’re republishing this beautiful, overlooked book, so that it may be widely accessible and no longer omitted from the past. Thought Forms offers a reminder that the history of modernist abstraction and women’s contribution to it is still being written.
Theosophy’s motto seems as appropriate today as it did in 1880, “there is no religion higher than truth.”
BOOK CONTRIBUTOR BIOGRAPHIES:

Authors
 Annie Besant (1847–1933) was a British socialist, women's rights activist, president of the Theosophical Society, writer, orator, and philanthropist. Regarded as a champion of human freedom, she was an ardent supporter of both Irish and Indian self-rule. She was a prolific author of over three hundred books and pamphlets. Besant greatly expanded the international reach of Theosophy, and represented it at the Chicago World’s Fair in 1893. Besant’s close co-worker in the Theosophical movement was C. W. Leadbeater, to whom she credited as helping her gain clairvoyance. Together they wrote about topics such as the human aura, the history of mankind, and the chemical structure of the universe. Besant continued to be a leader of Theosophy and a human rights activist until her death.

Charles Webster Leadbeater (1854-1934) was a member of the Theosophical Society and author of over sixty books and pamphlets. He was a high-ranking member of the society but resigned in 1906 amid a sex scandal involving adolescent boys. Besant championed and defended Leadbeater, eventually readmitting him back to the Theosophical Society where he was a leading member for the rest of his life even amid additional sex scandals. Leadbeater claimed clairvoyance and much of his work was about the “power to see what is hidden from ordinary physical sight”. Many of his books remain popular today and include such topics as the afterlife, dreams, vegetarianism, and Esoteric Christianity.

Editor
 Lucy Lord Campana is an artist whose observational based painting practice explores the limits of our collective vision. Recent projects include images from the Hubble Space Telescope, a series around X-ray use in diamond mining, and methane detection with infrared technology. She teaches drawing and painting at Columbia University.

Book Introductions
 Mitch Horowitz is a PEN Award-winning historian whose books include Occult America, One Simple Idea, and The Miracle Club. His book Awakened Mind is one of the first works of New Thought translated and published in Arabic. The Chinese government has censored his work. Twitter @MitchHorowitz | Instagram @MitchHorowitz23

Dr. Victoria Ferentinou is Assistant Professor at the University of Ioannina where she teaches art theory and history of art. She is the author of a number of articles and book chapters on international Surrealism and women artists, and on the relationship between modern art and esotericism. She is also a co-editor of Surrealism, Occultism and Politics: In Search of the Marvellous (Routledge 2017)
Troy Conrad Therrien is the curator of architecture and digital initiatives at the Guggenheim Museum and adjunct faculty at Columbia University and the Architectural Association where he teaches design studios and theory seminars to recontextualize architecture through magical, animist, and other esoteric perspectives.

campaign.story:
The dreaded Black Death has descended upon the town of Bristol. You are racing down the streets, desperate to escape into the safety of the countryside. If your cart is the first out of town you and your cart-mates win! Or do you? Some villagers on your cart may secretly already have the plague. If you leave town with a plagued villager on your cart, you will catch the plague and lose! What will you do to make sure that doesn’t happen? And who will you trust (or betray) along the way? 
Bristol 1350 is a social deduction and light strategy game for 1-9 players. Learn in 10 minutes and play in 20-40 minutes.
 Thank you to all of our backers for an incredible campaign!
If you missed the campaign you can make a late pledge here until fall 2020.
Backers can view project updates for information about delivery and add-ons.
Please visit our website or Facebook for the latest information on Bristol 1350.
We are excited to offer a Deluxe edition of the game! Depending on later demand, this Deluxe edition may be exclusive to Kickstarter, and at most it will be in rare distribution or only available at conventions. Beyond the core Standard edition of the game (+9 extra Kickstarter characters + stretch goals) the Deluxe edition includes: 
The 6 Deluxe coins to scale.
Every Kickstarter backer of Bristol 1350 (Standard or Deluxe) will receive 9 extra character cards in a special foil pack to add to their core copy of the game (for 18 total characters!) These characters will not be available after Kickstarter and are our way of saying thank you. We will reveal a new character every few days in the section below!    


We have upgraded every single component in the game with the space available in the box. Each upgrade represents our dedication to making high-quality and high-performing games at an affordable price. While we hope to include most of the upgrades listed above in future editions, they are only guaranteed for this first Kickstarter Standard and Deluxe printing of the game.   
The level of textural detail on the book, front and back, is kind of mouthwatering.
Bristol 1350 is a social deduction (lying & backstabbing) and light strategy game for 1-9 players. Learn in 10 minutes and play in 20-40 minutes. The game is enjoyable at all player counts, with lower counts leaning towards strategy and higher counts leaning towards social deduction, lying, and trust.
In the game each player begins in one of the three carts behind the starting line. Your goal is to be on the first cart to escape from the town. However, if anyone on your cart has the plague when you finish, everyone on that cart dies of the plague! Play continues until an all-healthy cart crosses or until everyone has the plague.   
You can view the full rules and print and play at this link. Note that the rulebook design is still underway, and if you want to play the print and play you'll need to construct your own dice and carts.
You can play for free online with Tabletop Simulator or with Tabletopia. 
As they become available, translations of the rulebook will be available on our website. We currently have translations available in French, German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, and Greek. 
Some of the intriguing mechanics are discussed by The Board Game Critic in this video. 
A full playthrough of a 5-player game can be seen at this link. 
A full playthrough of a 1-player game can be seen at this link. 
Bristol 1350 is Volume 4 in the Dark Cities Series! Each Volume is a stand-alone game that comes in the same sized faux book box, focuses on a particular city and year, and includes a dark or mysterious element in its game play. Each game accommodates at least 2-9 players. 
Games in the Dark Cities Series have already sold over 150,000 copies and are now played around the world! We're already hard at work on Volume 5, and we will continue expanding the series. We know your game closet is a mess. Start your bookshelf collection of games with the Dark Cities Series! Each of these games is available in certain reward levels and as add-ons.
You can add an unlimited number of copies of any games in the Dark Cities Series to your pledge! Just add the amounts listed above and after the campaign you'll select which extra games you'd like to be added to your order based on how much extra money you pledged. If you have any questions, please see the FAQ section, post a comment, or shoot us a message. 
Your shipping cost does not increase for add-ons regardless of your location or the amount of extra games you order. You will receive all add-on games at the same time that all of the Kickstarter rewards are received (estimated delivery April 2021).  
The 18 original character paintings by Sarah Keele are available to purchase! The paintings are 8 x 10 inches and made with mixed media acrylic on masonite board. You can see some of the intricate details below. Email sarahmkeele@gmail.com for more details or to check availability of a specific character.    
Though this is not an add-on you can get through the campaign, the people at Next Level Board Gaming are selling 3D-printer files so that you can create an EPIC 3D version of the Bristol 1350 board that you can use with your copy of the game. You can see more details by clicking the picture below.
Regardless of order size or add-ons, shipping costs are $6 USA, $8 UK/EU, $10 Australia/Canada, $12 for the rest of the world. We work hard to find the best shipping rates out there, and we subsidize some of the shipping costs so that you don't have to pay as much. 
To avoid extra VAT or customs fees, games will ship to depots around the world (USA, UK, EU, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong) before being shipped to you. For non-depot countries, in most cases there will not be extra VAT costs because the price of our games is low enough to avoid the duties threshold.
If your order is lost or returned due to unforeseen circumstances, we will attempt to reship your game one time, free of charge. If you provided incorrect shipping information, you will be responsible for the reshipment fee. Due to unreliable mail systems, we will not perform reshipments destined for Brazil, Ukraine, Russia, or South Africa. 
These days there are many projects that wait to charge shipping until AFTER the campaign ends in order to shift the risk from the creators to the backers. We have "done our homework" in regards to shipping costs and are prepared to take on unexpected risk. What you pay now for shipping is ALL that you will pay for this reward.
DISCOUNTED PRICE | Normal MSRP of the Standard Edition will be $25. If we release the Deluxe Edition to the public it will be at least $45. We also offer the best shipping prices we can during the Kickstarter campaign.
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE CARDS | The 9 Kickstarter Exclusive character cards (for a total of 18 characters in your game) will never be available again and will be unavailable to the public. Additionally, campaign stretch goals, as well as the Deluxe version, are only guaranteed through Kickstarter.
EARLY ACCESS | Receive and play the game before anyone else in the world. 
JOIN OUR TEAM | Get first-in-line knowledge and insight into the project, and a direct line of communication to us as the creators. We will take your feedback into account before launching production.
We fell in love with the Kickstarter community when we launched our first game, Salem, back in 2015. Those backers are the ones that allowed us to quit our day jobs and make games full time. We've had more great experiences with the launch of Tortuga 1667 and Deadwood 1876. The feedback, support, trust, and positivity from the community is incredible. We consider each Kickstarter backer to be a close ally in our game-making endeavors and we'll do everything we can to protect your trust in us.
Our thoughts are with those around the world suffering from Covid-19. We have been planning and preparing for this launch for over two years, but it has coincidentally lined up with the pandemic that our world now faces. We considered delaying the project but after a lot of thought and encouragement from our community we ultimately decided to launch. As with all our games, part of this game's purpose is to educate about the history of the world. Bristol 1350 explores the history of the worst pandemic our world has ever faced: the Black Death. The people of 1350 faced huge challenges, and today those challenges are perhaps more relatable than ever. We will be donating $3,000 from our own pockets to Action Against Hunger to assist in getting food and medicine for those most in need. (Per Kickstarter regulations, funds raised within Kickstarter will not be directly donated and have no effect on the donation amount).
This project is promoted by Green Inbox

campaign.story:
Hello friends! As so many of us worry about the future and yearn to return to the glorious spring unfolding outside our quarantined windows, we're excited to bring you our newest, most enchanted project...

Created by illustrator Kevin Jay Stanton, this 78-card deck features traditional paintings rooted in classical tarot interpretations that delve into the lore and mythology of the plant kingdom.
For over five hundred years, humans have used Tarot cards as a tool for divination and meditation. Their archetypal symbols have mystical, philosophical and psychological implications that allow us to understand our past, our future, and ourselves. But even older than that is the symbolism we've always assigned to the plants that grow around us. Hermetic, alchemical and scientific traditions explore flowers as tools for making meaning, medicine and magic. 
BOTANICA marries the tradition of Tarot to a lexicon far more ancient: the natural vocabulary of life on Earth. 

BOTANICA takes all of the major and minor arcana of traditional Tarot and reinvents them in the language of flowers. The Queen of Swords is Red Oleander. The Hermit is a Chinese Lantern. The High Priestess is the Elderflower. The Devil is Nightshade.

The deck features  the complete set of 78 Tarot cards, illustrated with acrylic and ink paintings. The Major Arcana are defined by single plants and flowers, and the Minor Arcana are plants combined with the objects from their suit, with regalia on the court cards.
The cards are 3.25" x 4.15", printed on premium heavyweight card stock and emblazoned on the back with gold foil. Each deck will come with a booklet naming the plants and objects on each card, and explaining the symbolic meanings of each card. 
The set comes in three editions: THE HERBALIST, THE ALCHEMIST, and THE ENCHANTER. The details of each set are listed further down.
Divination is the process of finding meaning in symbols or patterns, and similarly the act of reading tarot is finding patterns, meaning and visions in the symbols. A larger picture is created when a story is formed from how one card interacts with the next, as a bouquet is created from the harmony between many flowers.
BOTANICA can be read in many ways, depending on what you’d like to get out of it. To start, you’ll want to familiarize yourself with the deck. Light a candle, play some evocative music, and think about how you respond to the cards you’ve drawn. Without looking at the meanings, what’s the first card that really resonates with you? What plant strikes a chord in you on first sight? 
 After you know the deck a bit better, it’s ready for use. Plants have always been a foundational part of how we treat our bodies, and Tarot can be a tool to help sort our thoughts. Consider drawing a card in the morning to guide you throughout the day. Ponder a question and draw three cards to meditate on the foundation of a problem, what it looks like currently, and how to handle it in the future. Or lay out a full ten-card spread and really get to the root of it all. 
Here is a small sampling of the cards included in the deck, with notes from their creator.


THE LOVERS represents emotional decisions and the union between independent and equal partners. I chose peonies because they have flamboyant blooms that are "perfect flowers" -- a botanical term for flowers with both reproductive parts --  and for the generosity they exhibit in their symbiotic relationship with ants. I think it’s important for modern decks to capture the essence of The Lovers, and for me it’s about people being their whole selves and sharing that with others, the way peonies share their dew with ants and are protected from predators in turn.
 Like the floating seeds of a dandelion, THE FOOL sets out on their journey full of hope and with the promise of new growth. It’s a common plant, almost ubiquitous, and carries with it a naive quality I find appealing - I love the idea of making a wish by blowing on its seeds.
Tarot is sometimes described as the journey of the Fool through the deck. That’s why I picked a weed that could weather all of that and still come out on the other side with a feeling of charm and whimsy to be the major symbol of Botanica.
THE SEVEN OF WANDS is represented by Datura, or Thorn Apple -- a highly poisonous species of flowering shrubs pollinated by bats. I picked it for this card because the Seven of Wands is about being ready for a battle and having the endurance to see it through, and the fruit of datura reputedly have the ability to heal wounds as much as they can cause harm.
I picked Japanese vajra (a Buddhist ritual object) for the wands because they’re a symbol of enlightenment that embodies the balance between the five poisons to one’s purity and the five wisdoms that help one attain it.

THE FOUR OF COINS is a card is about being trapped by comfort. Honeysuckle bears flowers with a sweet aroma that wafts through the summer air, attracting all manner of creatures. It can be an extremely invasive species, and in those cases its vines can take over native plants and literally choke them. The Four of Coins is a warning to avoid excess, to take time to smell the flowers.
The coin symbol I picked for this card is wampum, a beaded Native American currency, as the Common Honeysuckle is a species native to the eastern coast of North America. The shells of this protocurrency were harvested off the coast and prized as much for their value as decoration. Their beautiful swirls of purple and white were often woven into belts by tribes like the Iroquois.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As the veterans of a dozen fully funded and fulfilled Kickstarter campaigns, Beehive Books founders Josh O’Neill and Maëlle Doliveux know well the challenges associated with funding, printing, and distributing beautiful oversized art books. Between our various ventures, we have raised nearly a million dollars on Kickstarter, and rewarded backers of every campaign with many beautiful books and other rewards.

We've carefully priced out expenses for domestic and overseas shipping, as well as printing costs for all rewards. We’ve arranged for the logistics of reward fulfillment. We know exactly how much money and how much work are required to get this project across the finish line. All we need is the funding necessary to finish the job. To be honest, our biggest risk is that in these turbulent times people won't have the funds to spend on art projects like these.

Still, there are more risks and challenges involved in making things with such high production values than I can realistically list here. Don't believe anybody who tells you this stuff is easy. Problems can and will pop up in ways we can't predict. (For instance, despite our considerable epidemiological expertise, we didn't see this global pandemic coming.) But our team has the knowledge, experience and commitment to persevere through difficulties and deliver a product that meets and exceeds the exacting expectations of our audience of discerning readers and collectors.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

PLAY

Hi friends! We're Fred Schroeder & Dave Kellett: Directors of the award-winning comics documentary STRIPPED. That Kickstarter-backed film got to #1 on iTunes, and featured the first-ever interview with Calvin & Hobbes creator Bill Watterson. And today, we'd like to talk to you about a new interview series focusing on comics and animation called Story/Line.
Story/Line will be a love-letter to the art of cartooning, featuring in-depth, thoughtful interviews about the craft. These will be deep conversations, in the style of a PBS or BBC interview. Each will be beautifully shot in 4K, with one of the best crews in Los Angeles. Among our four Kickstarted interviews, we've already scheduled with Academy Award-winning Directors Chris Miller & Phil Lord (Spider-Verse, The Lego Movie, and every other great movie from the last decade), Eisner-Winning cartoonist Scott McCloud (The Sculptor, Understanding Comics, 24-Hour Comics Day), and the Eisner-Winning cartoonist Raina Telgemeier (Smile, Sisters, Guts)!  
We're still booking guests for STORY/LINE. And like we did with STRIPPED, we're actively reaching out to a diverse variety of creators for this first season, and the hoped-for seasons to come!
As you can imagine, shooting at television quality and paying our crew and artists what they rightfully deserve costs *cough-cough* a big chunk o' change. We've already conducted an interview with Jake Parker (Skyheart / Inktober), and a secret BONUS interview (see reward tiers, below!) -- so we've been able to METICULOUSLY budget the costs for four more episodes. Have a look: 
And here's the really good news: If this Kickstarter allows us to make this first mini-season of Story/Line, we're hoping it lays the groundwork for ongoing seasons with many more interviews! 
 Here's a quick guide to help you decide what rewards you'd like for backing the project! 
 This Kickstarter is about the production of delightful, downloadable interviews -- so every reward will be getting that in one shape or another. But in addition to those episodes, higher tiers will also be receiving awesome items such as...
Fred Schroeder is an award-winning film-maker, with thousands of hours of TV, film, and commercial experience here in Los Angeles and around the world. He's been nominated for Best Cinematography at Sundance, and is insufferable about it. 
Dave Kellett is the Eisner-nominated cartoonist behind Drive and Sheldon, the co-director of Stripped, and the co-host of the weekly comics podcast ComicLab. He also holds two Masters degree in the history of comics, which prepared him for LITERALLY NOTHING ELSE BUT DOING THIS SHOW.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Keeping in mind that Story/Line will be produced by just artists, not a huge studio, there are two potential risks worth mentioning...

COST: We've already shot two "test" interviews for this project out of our own checkbooks, and therefore have a pretty meticulous breakdown of our costs. So, while filmed projects are notorious for unforeseen/unexpected costs, we believe we've safely projected what we'll need to complete the project as planned.

SCHEDULE: While there is always a risk that unforeseen production delays could occur, we are committed to making Story/Line. As we imagine, in the worst-case that this or that final interview gets delayed, we'll still be able to release the already-shot-and-edited episodes as we go.

campaign.story:
Bram Stoker made a radical choice in the writing of his classic novel Dracula. He presented it as a collection of found documents --  correspondence, newspaper articles, journal entries -- painstakingly transcribed and compiled into the published book by his characters themselves. His experimental approach brings you directly into the story, and refracts it through countless points of view.
DRACULA: The Evidence is an entirely new way to experience Stoker's masterpiece: through an actual physical research file full of ephemera, correspondence, clues and artifacts. It's the entire original text of Dracula, presented as a gorgeously designed and curated briefcase full of maps, letters, diaries, newspaper clippings, telegrams, and phonograph records. We've teamed up with Dracula expert and Bram's descendent Dacre Stoker to bring you the most immersive way imaginable to experience this modernist masterpiece of gothic horror.
 In our edition, you are not merely a reader – you are an explorer making your way through this archive of first-hand evidence, retracing this nightmarish story through the remnants it left behind: correspondence, charts and diagrams, memoranda, artifacts, photographs and much more. All housed in a custom designed briefcase, archival box -- or, in our most exclusive edition, a stone vault! (Yes. We're aware that we're crazy people.)
In a thrillingly immersive literary experience, Beehive Books invites its readers to become supernatural archaeologists. Crack codes, explore maps & blueprints, find clues. Climb inside our edition and discovers its secrets.
This Halloween, let's all invite Dracula into our homes... 
 We are publishing DRACULA: The Evidence as three different complete editions, and one special limited edition gatefold double-disc phonograph. All box sets are approximately 18x12x6" in size.
THE ARCHIVE EDITION
All of the evidence, presented in a leatherette briefcase with metal clasps. Hundreds of documents, including:
several books, including Mina Harker's journal, Jonathan Harker's diary, and more
dozens of letters, notes and telegrams
a playable phonograph record detailing Dr. Seward's care for his troubled patient Renfield
maps of the locations where the story unfolds, marked up by the characters
newspaper clippings and advertisements
train and theatre tickets
shipping manifests
travel itineraries
and much, much more. 

 THE IMMORTAL EDITION
A special edition box set presented in an archival solid wooden box, each numbered in an edition of two hundred and fifty and signed by Dacre Stoker, Paul Kepple and Josh O'Neill. Hundreds of documents, including everything contained in THE ARCHIVE, plus:
pressed flowers slipped into Mina's journal
skeleton keys to Carfax Abbey
the double-disc gatefold record set (see THE PHONOGRAPH below)
a complimentary suitcase, as included with the ARCHIVE EDITION
...and much more

 THE ENTOMBED EDITION
We will produce twenty-six premium editions, each lettered A-Z and signed and personally inscribed to you or an individual of your choosing by Dacre Stoker. The contents will be presented in an engraved stone vault. Includes all contents of the ARCHIVE and IMMORTAL editions, plus  a number of to-be-determined unique, hand-made items inserted into each ENTOMBED Edition, including:
pressed flowers slipped into Mina's journal
skeleton keys to Carfax Abbey
the double-disc gatefold record set (see THE PHONOGRAPH below)
a vessel of actual Transylvanian soil
partially burnt documents
unique handwritten (not printed) documents
actual communion wafers
a complimentary suitcase, as included with the ARCHIVE EDITION
...and more. 
THE RECORD
A special limited edition gatefold record set, including two colored vinyl discs containing Doctor Seward's audio notes detailing his care for the mysterious patient Renfield. Each record will be numbered in an edition of one thousand and signed by Dacre Stoker, Paul Kepple and Josh O'Neill.  THE PHONOGRAPH will also include ten illustrative prints on high quality art paper, and a number of ephemeral documents exclusive to this limited edition set.
THE MAP 
A 24x36” map of London, with locations marked and charted by the heroes of DRACULA. Offset printed on fine archival uncoated paper. 
Born in Ireland in 1847, ABRAHAM "BRAM" STOKER studied mathematics at Dublin's Trinity College and embarked on his longtime role as an assistant to actor Sir Henry Irving in the 1870s. He also began carving out a second career as a writer, publishing his first novel, The Primrose Path, in 1875. During this period, Stoker was part of the literary staff of The Daily Telegraph in London, and he wrote other fiction as well.
Stoker visited the English coastal town of Whitby in 1890, and that visit was said to be part of the inspiration for Dracula. Before writing Dracula, Stoker met Ármin Vámbéry, a Hungarian writer and traveller. Dracula likely emerged from Vámbéry's dark stories of the Carpathian mountains. Stoker then spent several years researching European folklore and mythological stories of vampires.
In 1897, Stoker published his masterpiece, Dracula. While the book garnered critical success after its release, it didn't achieve peak popularity until well after its author's death.
DACRE STOKER is the great grand-nephew of Bram Stoker and the international best-selling co-author of Dracula the Un-Dead (2009), the official Stoker family endorsed sequel to Dracula. Dacre is also the co-editor (with Elizabeth Miller) of The Lost Journal of Bram Stoker: The Dublin Years (2012). His latest novel, Dracul, a prequel to Dracula, released in October 2018, was co-authored with JD Barker and has been sold to Putnam in North America, Penguin Random House in the UK, and additional publishers in France, Spain, Italy, Hungary, Brazil, Serbia, Taiwan, Turkey, Vietnam, Czech Republic, Bulgaria, Portugal, and Poland with film rights purchased by Paramount Studios.
A native of Montreal, Canada, Dacre taught Physical Education and Sciences for twenty-two years, in both Canada and the U.S. He has participated in the sport of Modern Pentathlon as an athlete and a coach at the international and Olympic levels for Canada for 12 years. He is also an avid player and coach of the unique game of Real Tennis. In May of 2016 an athlete he has been coaching for the past 4 years, Camden Riviere, won the World Championships of Court Tennis. He currently lives in Aiken, SC, and together with his wife Jenne they manage the Bram Stoker Estate.
HEADCASE DESIGN is an award-winning graphic design and illustration studio located in Philadelphia that specializes in publishing. Paul Kepple is its founder, owner, creative director, and lead designer. Paul and his team at Headcase have created ambitious and richly elaborate designs that immerse readers in the diverse worlds of Stranger Things, Game of Thrones, Twin Peaks, The Sopranos, and J.J. Abrams’s and Doug Dorst's meta-novel S. They’ve designed behind-the-scenes books for the hit Broadway shows Hamilton, Wicked, and Dear Evan Hansen, cinematic properties like Harry Potter and Star Wars, and art-centric biographies for music legends Geddy Lee of Rush, Courtney Love, and Eminem. In 2012, Headcase co-authored and illustrated the darkly humorous Zombie Tarot, which put Paul’s vast knowledge of b-movies to good use and has sold over 40,000 copies. Their lavish touch is obvious in the artist monographs The Temple of Silence: Forgotten Works & Worlds of Herbert Crowley and MADNESS IN CROWDS: The Teeming Mind of Harrison Cady, both designed for Beehive Books. Their work has been recognized by AIGA, American Illustration, the Art Director’s Club of New York, Communication Arts, Graphis, How, Print, and was an nominated for an Eisner Award.
Paul is a life-long horror movie fanatic and Dracula enthusiast, and has spent many a childhood afternoon obsessively seeking out every Bela Lugosi and Christopher Lee incarnation in existence. He is very much looking forward to his biggest challenge yet — bringing new blood and a fresh take to Bram Stoker’s immortal classic.

BEEHIVE BOOKS is a Philadelphia-based boutique press founded by the artist and designer Maëlle Doliveux and author and editor Josh O’Neill. They create book art editions of great prose & pictorial works with a special emphasis on graphic art, design, and comics. Their line of books currently includes monographs on Harrison Cady and Herbert Crowley, illustrated novels with art by Yuko Shimizu, Bill Sienkiewicz, Dave McKean and Paul Pope, and the ongoing experimental periodical LAAB Magazine, curated and created by Ronald Wimberly.
In addition to being a three-time Eisner nominee, Beehive Books has won two Bronze Cubes from the Art Director’s Club and had two winners in the Communication Arts design competition. Their Illuminated Editions line has recently been exhibited at the Society of Illustrators in New York City.
We build paper worlds. Learn more at www.beehivebooks.com, or find us on Instagram @beehivebooks.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As the veterans of nearly dozen fully funded and fulfilled Kickstarter campaigns, Beehive Books founders Josh O’Neill and Maëlle Doliveux know well the challenges associated with funding, printing, and distributing beautiful oversized art books. Between our various ventures, we have raised nearly a million dollars on Kickstarter, and rewarded backers of every campaign with very beautiful books and rewards.

We've carefully priced out expenses for domestic and overseas shipping, as well as printing costs for all books, prints and ancillary rewards. We’ve arranged for the logistics of reward fulfillment. We know exactly how much money we need to get this project across the finish line. All we need is the funding necessary to finish the job. In fact, with such a substantial funding goal, the biggest danger is simply that we'll fall short of our ambitious aims.

Still, there are more risks and challenges involved in making books with this level of production value than I can realistically list here. Don't believe anybody who tells you this stuff is easy. This is the most elaborate project we've ever undetaken, and problems can and will pop up in ways we can't predict. But our team has the knowledge, experience and commitment to persevere through difficulties and deliver a product that meets and exceeds the exacting expectations of our audience of discerning readers and collectors.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Diving into the Demeter (and delays, delays, delays)
updates.update_content:
Fine ferocious friends,
We're deep in the long march now. Our little wagon is still slowly wending its way through the darkness towards the castle, and our sense of what awaits us at the destination of this strange journey fills us with hope and terror.
We've made tremendous progress towards getting ready to take this gloriously cursed project to print. We're wrapping up the calligraphy phase of the project, wrapping up the voice acting and audio assets and moving to the mixing/editing phase, and finalizing all of our research and sourcing on things like maps, logs, tickets, telegrams, letters, paper. Our sourcing is as thorough as possible in the search for ultimate authenticity. Here, for instance,  is our meticulous recreation of a Bulgarian 19th century telegram.

updates.update_userinfo: Production Schedule Update (w/ sneak peek at a Dailygraph clipping!)
updates.update_content:
Dearest Dracularians,
As Spring struggles to bring Philadelphia back from the long slow undeath of this brutal winter, we're watching our demonic flowers slowly begin to bud. DRACULA: The Evidence is moving along, closer to completion every day, with new art assets, test printings, manufacturing proofs, voice acting takes, and more.
Unfortunately, things are moving along much more slowly than we'd like them to. If I'm being honest, I have to admit that we really underestimated both the scale of this project, and the time-cost of our own obsessive perfectionism. We are hell-bent on getting every element of this project engineered seamlessly to exist both as a believable artifact of the Dracula narrative, and a readable and interactive experience. In retrospect, we might have guessed that it would take longer than we expected to nail it on the level that we hope to nail it.

Fellow fiends,
Just a quick update to let you know that all is still proceeding relatively smoothly on the Dracula front!
We're deep into grind time now -- our print deadline is in June, and we have literally hundreds upon hundreds of documents to produce by then. The page count of this project, taking into account each of its constituent documents, numbers over two thousand! And that's before you factor in the many suitcases, portfolios, artifacts, caskets, slipcases, and the seemingly endless other array of objects we're producing.

updates.update_userinfo: Stretch Goals Announced on our New Campaign!
"We can talk together freely and build our castles in the air." Announcing a grand new adventure!
Slowly But Surely Our Project Proceeds
updates.update_content:
Hello all you Dracuholics!
Just dropping in for another quick update. We have a lot of cool pieces now that I really wish I could show you. We'll be revealing a few bits and bobs over the fall, but I'm trying to keep as mum as possible for now.
But we've really now done most of the design on the big show-stopper pieces in the box set. Jonathan's shorthand journal, Mina's diary, Dr. Seward's record, our ephemera portfolio and the suitcase itself are all in the process of being print-tested already. Paul has been creating schematics for how these objects (and the rest of OVER FIFTY ITEMS contained in this ridiculous set) are laid out and packed inside the suitcase. The schematics are cool as hell and I want so badly to share them with you -- but I won't! No spoilers!

updates.update_userinfo: Project Progress and a Dracula Web Show
updates.update_content:
Greetings, Dracuphiles!
I hope you're all holding up OK through by far the craziest summer in recent memory.
We're deep into the Dracula season, now. By June 28th, Jonathan Harker is spending his final fateful day at Count Dracula, listening to the music of the children of the night.
Much like Mr. Harker himself, we're locked inside a gothic stronghold desperately scheming. We're making a lot of progress on materials, package designs, physical construction and visual presentation of DRACULA: THE EVIDENCE. The further we push, the more the scope of the project seems to grow -- but we're doing our best to keep it within the bounds of our budgets and capacities.

updates.update_userinfo: An Ancient Demon and Some New Witchcraft
updates.update_content:
Hello friends,
I hope you're all doing OK. This is a tough time for virtually everyone everywhere, and it has been for us as well. We've been scrambling to keep up with a lot of sudden changes in the book trade and trying to figure out how to keep our production lines together. The good news is we're still on schedule for delivery of Dracula, as well as most of our other projects. Our printers are still working, and our shippers are still delivering products. Meanwhile we're working away in our socially distanced cells, isolated as Renfields, swirling the million moving pieces of this project together. We're even working on a special new yet-to-be-announce add-on to this project that I think will thrill many of you.

First off, please accept our sincere apologies for the radio silence over the last couple weeks. We so badly wanted to announce that production was finished and the container was loaded as our next update. Instead we’ve been incredibly frustrated dealing with painfully slow production output resulting in shipping delays. 
We’ve been working with the factory management every night but haven’t been able to scale output due to a serious shortage of workers in the area. This can be a difficult time of year for our factories to hire and retain workers, but this season in particular has proven especially challenging in this region.

campaign.story:
The story of the West belongs to everyone . . . 
. . . and now that story is finally being told. 
Historians estimate that 1-in-4 cowboys were actually black, Latino, Native American, or even women!
First, why this book matters
While the American cowboy is, deservedly, a cultural icon and part of our America's mythology, what many people don’t know is that a significant percentage—probably around 1 in 4—of the nation's cowboys were African American, Latino, and Native American. Many cowboys were even . . . cowgirls! They were, in truth, everybody. And that means the story of the West belongs to every kid in America. 
Jackson Sundown, the famous Native-American rodeo star, on his legendary final ride at the Pendleton Roundup.
What you'll find inside
(Hint: incredible stories of black cowboys, women sharpshooters, pioneering vaqueros, Native-American rodeo stars, and more!)
The True West is packed with stories, biographies, quotes, facts, illustrations, and artifacts that tell the incredible feats of over twenty-five heroes: African Americans, Native Americans, vaqueros, women, and more.
Mamie Hafley could land her horse in a tub of water from a five-story tower!
Who's included in the book?
 Bass Reeves: The first black US Marshal west of the Mississippi and one of the greatest lawmen of the Wild West. He arrested over 3,000 criminals and was the man the Lone Ranger was probably based on.
 Nat Love (Deadwood Dick): A fantastic black rodeo star who became a legend in books and movies.
 Mamie Hafley: The incredibly courageous woman who dived off a 5 story tower into a pool of water on the back of her horse.
 Jackson Sundown: The Native American star who not only rode bulls and horses—but buffaloes as well!
 Annie Oakley: A small woman who became the world’s biggest celebrity—shooting cards held sideways at 30 paces!
 "Stagecoach Mary" Fields: The 6’2”, 200-pound ball of fire who let nothing stop her from doing her work and delivering the mail—not even a pack of wolves! She was also the first African American woman employee of the US Postal Service.
 Bill Pickett: The man who invented “bulldogging” and later became a movie star.
 Cathay Williams: The woman who joined the US Army—as a man!
 Fox Hastings: The trick riding woman who could stand on the back of a pony at full speed.
 Charley Willis: The black cowboy musician who wrote “Goodbye Old Paint” and other famous Western songs.
 Vaqueros: The pioneering cowboys who brought us many of the words we use today like lasso, rodeo, and buckaroo. 
 Chinese Workers: The intrepid builders who endured persecution and prejudice from every level of government and society while constructing the greatest engineering project of the century: the First Transcontinental Railroad.
 Levi Strauss: The Jewish businessmen who found greater respect and freedom in the West—and also invented blue jeans!
 Henry O. Flipper: The first black graduate from West Point who served throughout many Western campaigns.
 "Calamity Jane" Cannary: The indomitable frontierswoman who stopped a runaway carriage (among many other incredible feats)!
and more!
Gorgeous design rich with historical details
Every page is packed with facts, artifacts, original art, and other details that make an immersive educational experience. Kids can pore over this book for hours!
The 6’2”, 200-pound ball of fire who let nothing stop her from doing her work and delivering the mail—not even a pack of wolves! She was also the first African American woman employee of the US Postal Service.
Outside the book
The True West's cover has a beautiful velvety, matte finish with embossing to feel like leather. Tiny bits of gold foil and glossy details highlight intricate designs stamped right into the cover material. 
A message of unity and diversity
I’ve written this book in hopes that it will help bring the people of our country closer together by helping us understand the shared, but often unappreciated, history of our nation. Specifically, this book is about the incredible diversity of people who were part of the American West. In its own way, the Wild West was a “melting pot” every bit as much as the cities of the East Coast.

campaign.story:
The DeLand Centennial project brings two amazing decks of marked playing cards back to life. Originally printed in 1919, the Daisy Deck and Nifty Deck were created by Theodore DeLand. In honor of their 100th anniversary, we have recreated these ingenious decks from the ground up.
We have teamed up with renowned magician, graphic designer, and marked deck expert, Phill Smith (creator of the DMC ELITES) to create these stunning Centennial Editions. These are not simply reprints - each deck has been painstakingly redrawn and enhanced with new art and new features.
The Centennial Edition decks will never be reprinted and are offered here in a "Classic Edition" as well as a "Collector's Edition". When and if we pass a stretch goal of $25,000 we will print an UNMARKED "Gambler's Edition" of the decks.
Theodore DeLand was a genius creator and innovator in the magic world. DeLand lived from 1873 to 1931. Before departing this world, he left behind an enormous collection of mind-boggling creations. His best-known work is the "Dollar Deck", a groundbreaking marked deck of cards.
Few are aware that DeLand actually created many marked deck designs in addition to countless magic tricks. Originally offered in 1919, the Daisy Deck and Nifty Deck appear to be simple, innocent cards at first glance - but each deck holds many secrets waiting to be decoded.
Each deck has a full-bleed borderless back design that looks right at home on the poker table. We have meticulously recreated each design to be faithful to the original, while making small changes to make the decks more useful for the modern performer. 
To offer them as a complimentary pair, the Daisy Deck has been designed in a deep Burgundy and the Nifty Deck is dark Blue.
Not only is each deck marked to tell you the Suit & Value of every card, but there are other secret marks as well. We have expanded upon the core design originally created by DeLand and taken it a step further. In the Centennial Edition, each deck has OVER 500 MARKS in total. A quick glance at any card back will tell you the identity of not just one, but THREE different cards, as well as how many cards are left in a pile.
Every deck comes with an instruction card that will teach you how to decode the markings. The systems are hard to detect but are simple to learn and can be mastered with moderate practice. All backers will also receive a video download that teaches the marking system and the special stack order.
The tuck boxes feature all-new, 100% custom designs. The Classic Edition tucks will be printed with ink on a traditional stock. The Collector's Edition decks will have their tuck stock upgraded to a natural Kraft paper and will have the design stamped in foil.
Each tuck delivers a vintage vibe that has been elevated with a touch of modern elegance. We have happily unlocked our Custom Seal stretch goals. So now ALL versions of the deck will have custom sticker seals!
Classic Edition Seals (Render)
We absolutely LOVE vintage card faces. Both the Daisy Deck and Nifty Deck have gorgeous custom faces based on designs from the early 20th century.
The faces have been completely redrawn for modern printing, but fully capture the essence of vintage designs, including subtle asymmetry and small imperfections. 
The Ace of Spades and Jokers are faithful recreations of DeLand's classics.
Have you ever tried to fan or shuffle a 100-year-old deck of cards? It's not easy! Manufacturing techniques have improved immeasurably since the original 1919 decks, so one of the biggest upgrades that the DeLand Centennial offers over the originals is the handling quality.
We will be printing with the US Playing Card Company on a Classic stock with top-of-the-line coating for the ultimate performance for magic, games, cardistry, and more. The decks will be traditionally cut. This means that the cards are cut from face to back, which creates a minuscule yet important edge bevel that aids in executing card moves flawlessly.
In addition to the Classic Edition, we have created a limited Collector's Edition. The Collector's Edition decks will have special tucks made from Kraft paper and imprinted with foil, lovingly produced by the masters at Clove St Press.
Collector's Edition Seals (Render)
The Collector decks also come in an exclusive 2-deck Kraft storage box with gold foil. Since we have passed our stretch goal, the Collector Decks will also have custom, individually-numbered seals.
The Collector's Edition is strictly limited to only 500 sets ever produced.
When we reach a stretch goal of $17,000 or higher, we will also add gold gilding to the edges of the Collector's Edition decks. This is an exquisite addition that increases the beauty and the value of the Collector's Edition decks.
When and if we reach a stretch goal of $20,000 we will produce a beautiful 2" Commemorative Coin, which will be available as an add-on.
When we reach a $25,000 stretch goal, we will unlock an UNMARKED version of the DeLand Centennial decks. This "Gambler's Edition" will have the same great-looking tuck box and vintage faces of the Classic Edition decks, but the backs will be entirely unmarked and suitable for game play.
Gambler's Edition Custom Seals (Only produced if $25,000 Stretch is Reached)
The decks will also come in a standard new deck order instead of in a special stack. They will not be available in Stripper Deck versions. All of these features make them 100% suitable for life at the poker table.
Many of DeLand's original decks also had a "Stripper Deck" feature built in. This is where the cards have a slightly tapered shape to assist in several magic effects. We know that today's buyers may or may not want that option by default, so we are offering the Centennial Edition decks WITHOUT the Stripper Deck element built in by default.
For those who would like a Stripper Deck version, they can be purchased as an add-on. Simply increase your total pledge amount by $20 for each deck. The DeLand Centennial stripper decks will be factory die-cut and are perfect for beginners and pros alike.

Additional add-ons include Classic Edition decks as singles or by the dozen, as well as uncut sheets. Uncut sheets are decks that have been taken off the printing presses and sent out before being cut apart. They are great for framing and are a wonderful addition to your game room, office, or magic room.
To add-on any item, you do not need to change your primary pledge level. Simply add the desired dollar amount of your add-on to your total pledge. For example, if you are in the US and have pledged for the $40 Collector's Set and would like to add an uncut sheet, you would pledge $40 for the main level, add $5 for shipping, and $25 for the uncut sheet, bringing your total pledge to $70.
You will specify your add-ons in your BackerKit survey after the campaign has ended.

updates.update_userinfo: NEW Marked Deck - Bicycle Glider Backs
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! We hope you have all been staying healthy and safe!

Today we’ve released our latest custom deck - Bicycle Glider Back - and we wanted to share it with you! Since you backed our marked DeLand decks, we thought you might enjoy these! :)

Hi everyone!
Well, it's been quite a journey for this project. When we launched, who could have predicted what the coming months would have in store for the world?
Happily, the final piece of the puzzle - the Gilded decks/Collector Sets are SHIPPING! We began shipping them to backers yesterday, so many of you should be seeing them arrive super soon.
I just got my hands on a set (I live in a different state than our warehouse) and I snapped a few quick photos with my phone. I can assure you that these photos don't do justice to how great the Collector's Box, foiled tuck boxes, and gilded edges look. I think you will all agree that these were worth the wait!!

Hi everyone! Happy Tuesday!
It's exciting that DeLand Centennial decks have been reaching many of you! The FedEx shipment of the decks from the factory to our warehouse took longer than expected (as we have seen, most shippers are experiencing delays lately) but the decks did finally arrive safely, and we began shipping pledges about a week ago.
Several of you have received your decks already, and the feedback has been great!

Hi everyone. Very happy news to report! USPCC has finished the printing of the DeLand Nifty & Daisy decks!
As noted in our last update, this is for the Standard & Stripper decks only. The Gilded versions of the decks will not be done for a few more weeks, as is standard for that process.
The main decks are en route to our warehouse now. It will likely take about a week for them to arrive. Once they have been received by our shipping team & reviewed for damaged, we'll be ready to start sending out packages! Woohoo!!!

Hi everyone! We're writing with some really happy news!
We just got word from USPCC that the Regular and Stripper versions of the Daisy and Nifty decks are slated to be finished by the end of this week.
With luck that means that the decks leave the factory and are en-route to our warehouse by Friday. Transit from Erlanger to Cali is usually about a week. So right now we expect to be able to start shipping decks out to everyone right around the end of the month or beginning of July, assuming all goes well with the shipment.

Hello everyone. We hope you're doing well and staying safe.
We have some happy news to report. USPCC opened back up a few days ago as planned. They are under a heavy backlog of various projects that were in progress prior to the shutdown, but they are working hard to get everything back to normal and get projects out as quickly as possible.
Right now they've given us a completion ETA for the DeLand project of approximately mid June. This is a complex project with 2 decks that each have multiple variations, so there is a lot that goes into the finishing process. They're actually having a special meeting with their finishing department specifically to cover all of the details of this project to make sure everything gets done without a hitch.

Hi everyone. We hope that each of you is doing as well as can be expected during these difficult and unprecedented times.
Just wanted to pop in and give everyone an update on DeLand, since it's been a little while.
In our earlier update, we let you all know that UPSCC had shut down in accordance with stay-at-home policies. While USPCC is still shut down as of right now and does not have an official reopening date announced, we are happy to say that they have reopened their shipping department. So that is a step in the right direction back towards normalcy.

Hi everyone. Just a quick update for you all. First and foremost, we hope you are all healthy and safe during the Covid-19 pandemic. While it is a chaotic and uncertain time, hopefully we can all take advantage of having more time at home with our loved ones.
USPCC has announced that they will be shutting down as of tomorrow evening, in accordance with new policies recently put in place by their local government.
Right now the shut-down is slated to last for at least 10 days, at which point the situation will be reassessed. They may be able to reopen at that point, or they may have to have a prolonged closure.

Hi everyone. First and foremost, we hope you are all doing well and staying safe amidst the chaos of coronavirus as it sweeps the world. This is an unpredictable time and is affecting people from all walks of life across the globe. Like all things, it will pass with time, but it's important now to stay vigilant so that we can reduce the effects as quickly and effectively as possible.
Right now, as far as we know, production lines at USPCC are still operating as normal. We know that several personnel are working from home, but to the best of our knowledge the factory is running at normal capacity. This means that we still expect the decks to be completed around the end of March or beginning of April. More than likely we'll begin shipping around mid-April.

Creator and artist Alan Robert and Ghouliana return with another entry in the best-selling The Beauty of Horror franchise. Packed with the same meticulously crafted details, and devilishly dark humor as the books, The Beauty of Horror Tarot sets are another perfectly hair-raising addition for any horror fan’s collection.
The Beauty of Horror Tarot sets come in two terrifyingly tasty flavors: Fear Your Future and Color Your Destiny. Both sets contain 22 major and 56 minor arcana cards, all illustrated by Alan Robert. Fear Your Future is a more traditional tarot set featuring fully-colored standard sized tarot cards. While Color Your Destiny has black and white oversized tarot cards that are all uncoated and ready to color! Check out the pledges below to get more details!
Each Monday for 1 year, we’ll send you an email with a random tarot card from the Fear Your Future set. Along with the digital card, we’ll give you a short blurb about what that card means and insight from Alan about what inspired his art for the card.
Desire a spectacularly spine-tingling way to see what Ghouliana has in store for you? Then the Fear Your Future pledge is for you! A more traditional tarot set, Fear Your Future comes packed with 22 major and 56 minor arcana cards all illustrated by The Beauty of Horror mastermind Alan Robert, and fully-colored by iconic horror artist and colorer Jay Fotos. Fotos has a long history creating colors for horror comics Including Locke & Key, George A. Romero’s Road of the Dead, and Rising Rebels. Cards feature linen finish and are standard tarot size 70x120 mm (2.75x4.7 in).
