2/28///// UPDATE! We've officially cleared all stretch goals! Check them out below the deck descriptions!

The Neon Moon Tarot is a fully illustrated, 78-card tarot deck set in a retro-futuristic cyberpunk world using the archetypes and themes of a RWS tarot deck. Backers can expect a gritty urban hi-tech setting with a limited neon palette and heavy black inks. 
I've been able to work with different production sources to bring two different versions to this Kickstarter. The deck is available in both standard and pocket editions(details below).
Using the unique flexibility and depth of symbolism in the tarot, the Neon Moon deck emphasizes atmosphere and world-building. The RWS archetypes are alive and well here, merged with cyberpunk themes. 
The Neon Moon Tarot lives in its own unique world and does its best to bring you along. It asks you to use your gut to read meaning from the cards with intuition. But you aren't left out in the cold. Each card has associated keywords and quotes to get you started. If you'd like, you can  check them out right now at www.neonmoontarot.com
       The standard edition of The Neon Moon Tarot Deck measures 2.75 by 4.75 inches, and is printed on 300 GSM coated card stock. It comes complete with a custom rigid box and booklet. 
      The pocket edition of The Neon Moon Tarot measures 57 by 97 millimeters on 14 pt C2S coated card stock, and comes with a custom tuck box. 
Thanks to all of your support, we've hit the goal as of 2/17! Here are some extra goodies to look forward to as funding continues!
$6000 -UNLOCKED- Extra card unlocked! A second Fool card with a different take. Specific to this Kickstarter and won't be available in decks beyond Kickstarter backers. This reward will be automatically added on to both the pocket and standard editions of the deck, so if you've backed a tier with either you'll have an extra card for each deck.
$6500 -UNLOCKED- A short mini-comic in PDF format unlocks for all tiers! This comic will serve as an introduction to the Neon Moon's cyberpunk world. I'll be working on it myself in the same style that is present in the cards. 
$7000 -UNLOCKED- Pocket edition decks will now also include a booklet! Additionally, all backer tiers with physical product will receive a mini art-print of their choice(or random if the backer survey isn't filled out) from the deck with their package. Mini so I can fit it in without increasing weight or shipping costs.
$8500 -UNLOCKED- The short mini-comic PDF for all tiers from reward tier $6500 becomes a full length single issue comic(~30 pages) PDF for all tiers!
$10,000 -UNLOCKED- Along with your physical decks you will receive a letterpress printed prototype card of the next deck I’m working on. Additionally, we will unlock the Neon Moon Tarot Spread to the public. On top of that, the Neon Moon Card Game will also unlock for the public. Both will be posted to the Neon Moon website.
  The Neon Moon setting is my original take on a cyberpunk world. You'll see the usual themes of hi-tech low-life, A.I., cyborgs, corporations run amok, and more. For my version of the world, there is a divisive plate separating the rich and powerful from the masses underneath. 
The suit names have changed, along with the court cards, to better reflect the cyberpunk interpretation of this deck. They are as follows: 
Swords - Arms
Wands - Wires
Cups - Vials
Pentacles - Zent
Page - Apprentice
Knight - Agent
Queen - Supervisor
King - Executive
Above the plate, people can live essentially forever through a mixture of memory backups, clones, and "gene-therapy", which has resulted in a very strict society under constant surveillance by the most powerful members who have been alive for hundreds of years and in that time have accumulated power and wealth. The court cards effectively play the roles of those most powerful members of this society living on top of the world. 
For the minor pips, they depict life beneath the plate. I've strayed a bit from convention and things are more of a neon-lit, urban mad max than they are Neo-Tokyo. People are mostly too poor to advertise to, so most of the advertisements are aimed at pure necessities. Gangs roam what's left of the streets, sponsored militias run through on orders from above the plate, poverty is rampant and conflict is everywhere. People live short and violent lives of desperate struggle, and find hope and strength through banding together with friends. 
Outdated robots, discarded from above, hack into each others' firmware with updates giving their A.I. freedom. Gene-therapy is largely experimental and therefore much less stable than above the plate. People have started giving themselves vanity alterations in addition to performance enhancing ones. The internet is patched from a local mesh of wires that are strung from building to building, from the underside of the plate down to the ground. This accounts for the imagery of the minor pips. Previous ideas of what it means to be human, imposed by the ruling class, struggle against the people who remake themselves into a thousand different versions of humanity.
And yet something new arrives with a strange, neon pink full moon. Magic begins to surface in the city, along with strange occurrences and impossibilities. Somehow, it seems to be relative in power to the waxing and waning of the moon. 
Each card is meant to evoke a particular piece of this world, using the archetypes available from the Rider-Waite-Smith tarot. I chose tarot specifically to bring this setting to life as it allowed me to emphasize the ambiance and themes of the world while letting a larger cast of characters be depicted than other mediums would comfortably allow. As with any tarot deck, every card has a piece of story behind it, and every combination of cards tells a different story. 
      Out of the goal of $5500, funds are estimated to be allocated accordingly:
Estimated shipping costs - 15% ($825)
Estimated Kickstarter fees - 10% ($550)
Estimated production costs for both versions of the decks, boxes, and booklets - 75% ($4125+personal funds added)
The estimated timeline, and product status is as follows:
Mid-Late March - Campaign ends and funding transfers. Wallpaper+Avatar packs are done and ready to send out. PDF Booklet is also ready to send out. The Neon Moon Tarot Spread and Card Game will be put on the website and added as additional PDFs for backers. I'll place orders with my print shops for decks and booklets. Work has started on the 30-ish page PDF Comic.
April - Depending on order sizes and shipping times, I should start to receive product from my print shops in early to mid April, which I'll start to assemble and send out to backers. While I wait for product to arrive, I'll be letterpress printing prototype cards for the 10k stretch goal. Work on the PDF Comic continues.
May - Except for unexpected shipping delays, most backers should have received rewards. I should be finalizing the PDF comic reward at this point and I'll send it out when it's finished.
    I'm James Brothwell, and this is both my second Kickstarter campaign, and my second complete tarot deck. My first campaign for The Sinking Wasteland Tarot was fortunate enough to not just fund, but to hit all of its stretch goals as well! I've previously been involved with comics, computer games, movies, and the odd commission work that's landed me in strange and exciting places. 
Thanks to the success of the last campaign, I was able to put my nose to the grindstone and finish up The Neon Moon Tarot, and I'm very pleased to be able to offer it for you all now. I started work on this in the last couple of months of 2016 and only recently finished artwork for the last of the cards at the end of January 2018. 
I'm hoping that this deck will speak to those who, like me, are sometimes left wanting for a tarot deck that depicts a more urban environment, and incorporates technology throughout.
Introduction video Music by Gavin Luke.
Explanation video music by TeknoAXE.
Images represent prototypes. Final product may differ slightly.
I do offer worldwide shipping but I'm sorry to say that I have little control over shipping costs or customs fees. If you order from outside of the US, please be aware that I've done my best to keep weights down, prices affordable, and shipping tracked. Still, some things are simply beyond my control. 
Finally, thank you to all of the backers, friends, strangers, and fellow internet oddities whose enthusiasm and support allows projects like this to exist and thrive. Much love. <3

campaign.story:
Hey! Welcome to the redesign Kickstarter launch for Grid Series Two, the typographic playing cards.  
The Grid playing cards are a three part collection based on the design principals of the International Typographic Style, otherwise known as the ‘Swiss Style’ of graphic design. Series Two has been reworked from its original launch because I wanted to refine the design and bring the whole deck closer to the original concept set out by Series One. I feel now, the whole deck has a cleaner more precise and elegant look, one that is important to have in every collection.
Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
Originally starting in the 1920s in Germany, the Netherlands and Russia, the ‘Swiss Style’ later developed in Switzerland in the 1950s. It’s main principals are readability and cleanliness, with most creations adopting an asymmetric layout, always based on the use of a grid. These grids, usually made up of hidden columns and rows, are used to align words, numbers, pictures and patterns and so each series in the Grid collection adopts these principals. The works of designers such as Ernst Keller and Josef-Müller Brockmann have been a real inspiration from a graphic point of view. 
Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
  Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
The cards are poker size and printed by USPCC but are far from traditional. These cards will be printed on linen, magic air cushion stock which I know first hand really does feel like nothing else with fully customised tuck box and seal. As a graphic designer more than an illustrator, as well as a card collector, I wanted to find a way to combine two of my biggest passions and make a collection of decks which truly stand out from the crowd. I fully appreciate the incredible work of designers of other playing cards currently in the world, I am often drawn to the cards with incredible detail and illustration. After all, I am a Kickstarter backer as well as a creator. Personally, I see the detail of my decks as ‘less is more’, doing away with traditional pips and instead adopting a typographic format, with each card acting like a miniature poster, with bold words setting the theme rather than illustration and numbers.
Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
  Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
I have tried to keep the design minimal but functional, even the back of the card is super stripped back to just the name of the deck, with full colour bleed for real impact of colour. If, for example, you look at my version of the picture cards, they each have a diagonal line introduced as a minimal graphic, like a poster, but it replicates the diagonal line often found on traditional picture cards where the suit is duplicated and rotated. It’s a small detail but it’s my way of reflecting tradition.
Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
  Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
With Grid Series Two, as well as vertical and horizontal alignment like in Grid Series One, I have introduced the circle to create a dial effect and explore how different grids can be adopted on playing cards. Each card has a bespoke set of alignment with the numbers and letters that sit on the edge of the circle so that they visually look to have the same alignment, whilst not always sitting in exactly the same place on each card.
Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
  Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
The cards can be read and viewed in many different ways with only two being symmetrical.
A) The card is written in it’s full name; seven of diamonds. 
B) Traditional use in the corners with 7 and the diamond pip. 
C) Written with upper and lowercase next to it; Seven / Diamonds. 
D) Around the circle there is the current sequence of cards before and after; 6 7 8. 
E) Short hand code in the upper right corner; se/di 
F) In the lower left corner similar to Grid Series One, the current card is shown by the pip and lit up dots, with ones that don’t apply being faded out for ace to ten, and then switching to diagonal lines for the picture cards; diamond pip with 7 white dots.
Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
  Grid Series Two - Standard Edition
  Each backer will receive 2 free phone background images of their selected cards available for download, as well as a PDF certificate of gratification to download. This is to say thank you and will include your name and backer number. Backers who would like these bonus items just need to message me after funding to confirm selection and I can send the files to them.
Two custom phone backgrounds for every backer
   Signed Standard Edition
If you would like your deck signed, simply increase your pledge by £5 per deck and message me to confirm this add on. You will be able to choose where the deck is signed and if you would like it resealed with protective plastic cellophane.
Limited Edition
The limited edition Grid Series Two deck is an extremely rare product. There will only be 20 made, they will also never be printed again. These will be printed on professional grade plastic coated, lower stock than the standard edition, the same I used for Series One limited edition, this is purely because the print run is so small, I need to use a different printer to get them made. From previous campaigns, I know these are highly sought after, so keeping them so limited increases their exclusivity.
Update - I did post this in my first update but thought best to note it here as well; the limited edition decks are currently all reserved, but if you would like to be added to the waiting list please still do message me!
Grid Series Two - Limited Edition
  Grid Series Two - Limited Edition
Every deck will be numbered and signed in a place of the backers choice. There is no limit to how many decks each backer can request out of the 20 made. Every deck will come with a printed certificate of ownership, signed and numbered to match the deck.
Grid Series Two - Limited Edition
  Grid Series Two - Limited Edition
Each deck will cost £25 which includes delivery and certificate of ownership. If you would like to add on any limited edition decks, please private message me directly to reserve a deck and be added to the waiting list. You can do this by going to my creator profile and contacting me from there. Only once I confirm the availability, then you may increase your pledge.
Grid Series One
If you missed out on the first project and are looking to get up to date with the the whole collection, please message me to confirm stock and add on price - I have limited stock left available. Series One is where it all began, don't miss out, these are two decks that every collection needs! 
Grid Series One - available as add on
  Grid Series One - available as add on
  Grid Series One - available as add on
  Grid Series One - available as add on
Single Card Poster
420x594mm (A2 paper size), 200gsm satin finish. Pick any card you like from the deck, front or back, and have it as a poster! The poster will also have your own backer number on there and will be signed on the back. This reward is available to back without the playing cards, or as an add on. 
For UK backers, please add on £12 to your pledge for each poster you would like, or for the rest of the world, please add on £15 per poster.
Single card poster add on
All Cards Poster
960x390mm, 200gsm satin finish. The poster will also have your own backer number on there and will be signed on the back. This reward is available to back without the playing cards, or as an add on.
For UK backers, please add on £12 to your pledge for each poster you would like, or for the rest of the world, please add on £15 per poster.
All card poster add on
Personal Printed Bundle
This unique add-on gives comes in three parts, all for the price of one! 
3 for 1 - Printed Bundle Add-On
Included is a staple bound A5 booklet containing design insight to the Grid collection, as well as my own interpretations of work by designers that have inspired me. With a minimum of 16 pages and printed on 120gsm uncoated paper, take a look inside the grids behind the Grid cards, enjoy a range of other artwork and further details behind the design theme. This will be signed on the inside too.
THREE bespoke A5 prints of any information you like, in the style of the Grid Series Two! You can give me any information you like, from your name, how many dogs you have, where you are from, your favourite number...anything you like, and I will make a bespoke print for you! You can give me three different sets of details, or I can give you it three different ways! each print will be on 220gsm card, and signed on the back of each print. These little keep sakes make a perfect addition to your desk, bedroom wall, or anywhere you like, it's totally up to you. These are like postcards, not a deck of cards.
Stickers! These 70x40mm stickers are weather-proof, so put them wherever you like! Each pack contains 3 stickers, 1 of each design.
The price for all of this is only £8! To add this bundle on, simply increase your pledge by £8 per bundle (2 bundles = £16 etc), delivery is included, and message me to confirm your selection!
Bespoke print, post card style
  As we go through the funding phase, more stretch goals will be added.
£8500 - Dealer's coin / Poker chip Add-On
£8500 - All backers to have the option of receiving printed certificate of ownership and gratitude instead of download, as well as free stickers for those that choose the printed option
£10,000 - Card stock upgrade
So, thank you for taking the time to come to this project and hopefully support it! If you could please ensure to spread the word, share the project on any social media channels too, that would be great! Any questions, please let me know, I always listen to feedback and have close communication with my backers so just shout! 
Feel free to follow me on Instagram  @luke_wadey_design
and tag the project #gridseriestwo #lukewadeydesign
Thank you!

My apologies for the radio silence, things have been very quiet my side while I waited for USPCC to confirm completion of production.
I am very pleased to see production has now completed so keep your eyes peeled for all your rewards to start arriving!

Hey everyone,
Unfortunately some bad news came this week! USPCC instructed me that all of the decks had been scratched on the production line and would need reprinting. As this was their error, they have fast tracked the process and so we can now expect production to complete in the next couple of weeks. I am so sorry for this delay, I am just as annoyed as you are about this! The good news is we are still ahead of schedule. I have decided to hold back on sending out the limited edition until the standard edition has been shipped to Gamblers Warehouse, this way the decks will be received closer together out of fairness.

campaign.story:
Welcome to our project! 
My name is Mankin Chan and I am a Dutch product and graphic designer with a big interest in playing cards.This is my second custom playing cards project on Kickstarter, after successfully funding Cultura Playing Cards in 2015.
This time I wanted to create a deck that is suitable for both collectors and players. The goal is to provide an alternative for the regular playing cards you use to play games with, but in my own unique flat design style. So I'm proud to present to you: Essentia Playing Cards!
  Features:  
54 fully customized poker size cards
Fully customized tuckbox on matte stock
Printed by LPCC
Classic finish
Casino grade quality
Silver foiling on tuckbox (stretch goal: €6500)
Numbered stamp sticker seal (stretch goal: €7000)
Inside tuckbox printing (stretch goal: €8000)
Essentia is a fully customized deck of cards, with unique artwork on all 54 cards. Designed for both players and collectors.
Court cards 
The court cards are based on standard courts, but completely redesigned from scratch in my own flat design style. I paid a lot of attention to the details that are hinting back to the standard courts. This way the courts are completely customized yet still very recognizable! 
overview of all the Essentia court cards
Aces 
I chose to customize the pips for all aces to make them stand out from the other cards. The ace of spades got some extra attention like usual, with an even larger pip and some decorative texts! 
overview of the aces
Jokers 
The jokers in this deck are represented by The Four Magician Brothers! They each represent their own pip, which is very noticeable when you take a closer look at their clothes. The brothers are divided into the black magicians and the red magicians. Unique jokers that fit the style of the Essentia Deck perfectly! 
The four magician brothers as jokers
Pips 
Set of pips designed from scratch
The pips of this deck all fit within a rectangular shape. The curves of the circles are also matched between the pips as much as possible. By using this framework the pips became a nice coherent set. Completely unique pips in a two tone flat design! 
Number cards
traditionally arranged pips on the number cards
The number cards have traditionally arranged pips, because these cards are also made for players. Traditional arranged pips are best suitable for this!
  The back design of the card is a personal version of the well known argyle pattern. I wanted to increase the detail level by customizing each 'diamond' with nice decorations and pips. A dark and light blue color is used to create a nice contrasting back design that looks both classy for playing and interesting for fanning.
    For the tuckbox design, I wanted to create an overall clean look with the focus on the front and the back. I chose a dark blue main color to give it a sophisticated appearance.The front and back features a variant of the back design pattern in nice contrasting colors. The box will be printed on matte paper that works great in combination with flat design artwork. 
A classy tuckbox with lots of details that will look great in every collection!
And on top of that: the stretch goals will make the tuckbox totally awesome!
You can add various extra items to your pledge, simply by increasing your pledge with the right amount of money.  Here is a list of the cool Essentia add-ons! 
Extra decks
You can add extra decks to your pledge to get the exact number of decks you want. If you want 8 decks for example, you can pledge for the 6 decks tier and add 2 decks by increasing your pledge by the right amount of money. You can find the additional costs in the overview table below.
add extra decks to get the exact amount you want
Leather travel case (+ €17)  
This limited edition travel case will keep your deck clean and crisp when you toss it in your bag during traveling. The case is made of high quality genuine leather and it fits the Essentia deck perfectly. On the front side you will find a nice debossed and silver printed Essentia logo.
Only 100 pieces of these travel cases will be made, so be sure to grab one before they are all gone! (41 left @ 27/02/2018)
Limited Edition genuine leather case
  Close up of the debossing and silver foiling
Uncut sheet (+€30)  
An uncut sheet of the Essentia deck looks great on the wall as a unique decorative item. It is nice to display something different than regular posters or art pieces. These sheets will only be printed once, so they are a great collectors item and serve great as a unique gift!
Essentia uncut sheet (frame not included)
Overview 
If you want to add one of the products to your pledge, simply increase your pledge with the correct amount of money. You can find a list of the add-on prices in the overview table below.
For example: If you want 3 decks and 1 leather case, please select the 3 decks pledge tier and add €17 to your pledge. So your total pledge amount should be €30 + €17 = €47 (€33 + €17 = €50 for international backers) 
Example 2: If you want 2 decks, an uncut sheet and 2 leather cases, please pledge for the 2 decks tier and add €30 for the uncut sheet and €31 for the two leather cases. Your total pledge amount should be €22 + €30 + €31 = €83 (€24 + €30 + €31 = €85 for international backers)
I have set up some stretch goals to add extra features on to the deck after the funding goal is reached. These enhancements will make the decks even more attractive and unique!
    The Essentia Deck will be manufactured by the Legends Playing Cards Company, which is a well known company by playing card enthusiasts. The quality of their decks are among the best of the world. 
To ensure that your decks arrive safe and quickly, Legends will also handle the fulfillment of the decks. They did a great job last time for my Cultura project, and I am sure they will deliver the same quality this time.
If you are wondering what the shipped price per deck is for all the pledge levels and don't want to calculate it yourself, you might find the table below very useful! 
  The exchange rates of euro and other currencies change every day, so this is just an indication of the exchange rates at this moment.  
€1,00 = 1,238 USD
€1,00 = 0,879 GBP
€1,00 = 1,529 AUD
The picture below shows the phases of this project. I will do my best to deliver everything according to this timeline. In the meantime, I will post some project updates regularly to keep you all informed.
    Here are some cool freebies for all backers and visitors of this project: Exclusive Essentia profile badges! Use them for your Kickstarter and/or social media profiles to show that you are a proud backer of Essentia. A great and easy way to help promote this project! 
You can download them on the Essentia Facebook page:
Free Essentia profile badge

campaign.story:
THANK YOU!
Well the campaign has been amazing, thank you for being a huge part in it's success!  Of course it's just the beginning in making these special decks. I'm really looking forward to seeing them completed and on their way to you soon.  
I'll update here of course, and if you missed out, visit originscards.com
With sincere appreciation, Rick
In my previous campaigns I created premium quality decks based on some of the earliest traditional playing cards.  The decks have had amazing feedback.  My goal is always to produce a higher quality deck than the standard Kickstarter and I’m now very excited to look to the future with De Novo, the United Cardists 2018 annual decks!
Where will we be hundreds of years from now, when the world we know today is forgotten?
De Novo - meaning 'starting anew’ - conceptualises playing cards from a distant future with an elegant yet futuristic accent.
Unique design, metallic green & gold foiled tucks
Inner foil on both tucks
High quality tuck stock
Fully custom designed cards
Green & Gold metallic ink backs
Premium black core casino grade cards
Campaign only special pricing
All packs shipped in protective boxes
The premium tuck boxes of De Novo are hot stamped in green (Viridi) and gold (Aurum) foils with a unique mirror design that makes the pair a perfect collectors set.
          The court cards of Viridi and Aurum feature complimentary yet unique styles - full colour illustration for Viridi, strong metallic inks for Aurum.
Inspired by today's standard design, each suit imagines characters from influential groups. The cards will remain a work in progress over the course of the campaign as I improve and finetune.
              The De Novo backs feature ornate full metallic backs in green and gold. The artwork depicts a powerful global artificial intelligence, providing an instantaneous link to it's vast knowledge through a neural chip.
The standard suits have evolved but remain familiar for easier recognition.
    Excellent!  Our First Stretch Goal is the addition of Embossing. This will lift the metallic foils and really make them pop.  For me, embossing is like icing on a cake.  Love it!
We already have inner foil but at $30K we'll take the inner foil one step further and add Internal Artwork.  Because we can.
These decks are already premium but this is a big one.  Every deck in each set will be numbered, and we'll do our best to keep pairs together.
  Enhance your pack with these special additions. Like the decks themselves, these are available in a limited supply.
To add the above items to your De Novo pack:  
1. Click the 'Manage your Pledge' or 'Back this project' button.  
2. Enter your pledge total in the Pledge Amount box with the amount of your pledge tier and add-ons combined.  
3. Once the campaign is closed you'll receive a survey where you can list the items you've pledged for.
Thank you for being a part of this exciting campaign.  
I was proud to be asked to produce the United Cardists deck for 2018.  The forum has many passionate members, who were a huge help in my step into the world of card design.
Over the last year or so I've created the Shadows of History deck, Rouen 1567 deck, Shadows Black Label, LUXX Greilles, and most recently the Cobra deck for JP Games.  It's been an amazing and busy time.  This may be my last campaign before I take a little important time out with my boys.  Thank you to everyone for your amazing support.
I'm very excited to be working with another perfectionist in card production, Lotrek of OathPlayingCards. The decks will be printed in Greece by OPC under his close supervision. De Novo will be the first decks to feature OPC's "MAESTRO" finish, a coating that is specially formulated to give very smooth, high slip and silky handling. Lotrek has been developing the formula over the past 2 years and he is proud to present it through De Novo. The decks will be printed on the finest 320gsm playing card stock imported from France.
Shipping will be taken care of by the same experienced team who provided excellent service in my last campaign, with quality well boxed pledges.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my third Kickstarter, and I am confident in the planning and team I have in place for this campaign. Minor issues can arise in production, but I always work hard to ensure all backers are pleased with their pledges.

Please note that there can be delays in shipping. In my previous campaign, domestic shipping across the US was over two weeks, and longer internationally, so I appreciate your patience as the packs ship.

I am always improving the art so work shown above is subject to modifications and updates before production. All visuals are also concepts only and may vary slightly in the final product.

While I do my very best to honour every pledge, unfortunately I cannot be held liable for replacement of packs damaged or missing during shipping. Please ensure you enter your address correctly when asked at the end of the campaign.

Thank you again for being a part of this journey into the future!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi team, 
Well I'm very happy to say a beautiful big box of treasure arrived today, and the quality of these decks are just excellent - as expected.  
It's always a nervous moment.  Months and months of hard work staring at a screen choosing colours and shapes suddenly become real blocks of art in your hand.  This project itself has consumed a large part of my life for the best part of a year and a half.  I'm very pleased with the result.

Hi everyone,
I’ve had some very good news. Production of the De Novo decks are complete and will be going to fulfillment soon. I have a shipment heading my way to complete the Special Editions and we can soon begin sending out your packs.
More soon, Rick

updates.update_userinfo: Happy New Year & a progress update
updates.update_content:
Hello again!
Well another update with production progress.  Not yet shipping - BUT I do have a little good news..
Lotrek and I have both found the delay tough and want this project to be worth your wait.  In discussing this, Lotrek felt he could improve the decks and asked to upgrade both De Novo packs at his own cost.  The result = more metallic inks on Aurum - and the addition of metallic golds to Viridi. This will be the first full colour deck with the inclusion of metallics I've worked on.

Hi everyone.  Just a quick update on production of De Novo.  Again, thank you for your extreme patience - it's been a pretty tough couple of months, but I do have good news.  
As you may know, Lotrek Oath is working hard to have the decks completed, and has had a few production delays - not just affecting De Novo but his own decks also.  He has passed on his sincere apologies but I know he has been working hard on this.  The good news is he expects the decks to be ready early November.  From there they will need to be packed and shipped so I will keep you informed on timeframes as we proceed.

Hi everyone, 
This is just a very quick update to let you know production of De Novo is back underway and proceeding as planned.  I don't have concrete dates as yet but will keep you informed of progress.  Thanks again for your amazing patience, I am truly looking forward to seeing the decks on their way to you.
More soon,
Rick

Our campaign is now over! But don't worry, you can still join in our pledge manager which will soon be online. Click here to find out more and here to subscribe to our newsletter to stay in touch.
     Welcome to the 3rd campaign of our succesful metal coins. 
We are proud to have completed and fulfilled 2 big campaigns so far, creating no less than 21 different thematic coin sets.
Year after year, we continue developing our coins and we are again offering new coins, with Improved quality.
We want our coins to feel Real giving players an immersive experience in our games but we also want each single coin to feel substancial. To achieve that, we make our coins Big, Premium and Heavy. Our coins do not have any numbers on them, so that they can have different denominations according to the needs of each game.
Each coin set contains 24 coins (10 copper, 8 silver and 6 gold) but more might be added through Stretch Goals (so far 3 more coins have been added for a total of 27 coins).
Also available, at the same price, are the Unit coin sets, which do have denominations on them and consist of 30 coins (19 copper, 8 silver and 3 gold), and are also going to gain more coins through Stretch Goals (at the moment one Gold and one Copper have been added).
All backers will get one Drawlab 1st player token regardless of their pledge, for free. 
At the end of the campaign a pledge manager will be online, in which you will be able to select your rewards easily and give us your address to ship them.
On the pledge manager itself shipping costs will also be paid, and EU citizens will pay any VAT fees as needed.
Now, without further ado, let us introduce you our new coin sets.
      Post Apocalyptic coin set
  The world has changed. Nothing is as we know it and money is no different. Play your favourite thematic dystopic games with the proper coins.
Copper. Diameter: - 32mm Thickness:- 3mm
Silver.    Diameter: - 32mm Thickness:- 2mm
Gold .     Diameter: - 35mm Thickness:- 3mm

Games where the coins can be used at: Fallout, Outlive, 51st State,  and in all games set in a Post Apocalyptic Universe.
Wizard coin set
  A proper wizard has always the right amount of gold on him. These coins have been developed to be used as currency in a vast variety of fantasy games, or even as tokens of power in any RPG or game system.

Copper. Diameter: - 32mm Thickness:- 2mm
Silver.   Diameter: - 32mm Thickness:- 2mm
Gold .    Diameter: - 32mm Thickness:- 2mm

 Games where the coins can be used at: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle, Alchemists, Mystic Vale, and in all games with at least one wizard creating chaos.

Japanese coin set
  Inspired from original coins and art of the rich Japanese culture, we are now presenting you our newest addition in the historical metal coins. Use them wisely to hire samurais to guard your treasure.

Copper. Diameter: - 32mm Thickness:- 2mm
Silver. Diameter: - 38mm Thickness:- 2mm
Gold . Diameter: - 45mm Thickness:- 2mm

Games where the coins can be used at: Rising Sun, Tokaido, Yamatai, Yokohama, Nippon and in many other games inspired by the rich culture of ancient Japan.
Vampire coin set
    Vampires have been one of the main monstrous characters in human fantasy, with many games adapting them as their main vilains or heroes. Use them as simple transaction objects or use them to mark your victims.

 Copper. Diameter: - 30mm Thickness:- 3mm
Silver. Diameter: - 32mm Thickness:- 3mm
Gold . Diameter: - 34mm Thickness:- 3mm 

     Games where the coins can be used at: Vampire: The Masquerade, and in all games reminding something out of Transylvania.
Medieval Units coin set
  After the great success of our Unit Coins in Season 2, we have now created another coin set with denominations on them. Small enough to be handled in board games, with denominations 1/5/10 but with the aesthetics of a beautiful medieval coin, the Medieval Units contain 30 coins per set.

Copper. Diameter: - 23mm Thickness:- 3mm
Silver. Diameter: - 27mm Thickness:- 3mm
Gold . Diameter: - 30mm Thickness:- 3mm

 Games where the coins can be used at: All games set in Medieval Europe.
Stretch Goal #1
Copper:  Diameter 31mm, Thickness: 3mm  
Silver:     Diameter 31mm, Thickness: 3mm 
Gold:       Diameter 32mm (on the big side) Thickness 3 mm
 Copper: Diameter 32mm, Thickness: 2mm

Season 1 & Season 2 coins are also available
Each backer can also choose from the big selection of our coins that we offered in Season 1 (13 different coin sets) and Season 2 (8 different coin sets).
Stretch Goals will be included in any coin set chosen regardless of its Season.
          We love our coins but don't just take our word for them. Watch what established reviewers say about them.
Undead Viking
The Unfiltered Gamer
Boardgame Breakfast
Antonios S - RPG.net
'I have reviewed practically everything from the Legendary Metal Coin Series, and I keep coming back for more. Match their consistently high quality to their cool designs, and you have a winning combination. Season 3 continues on the same lines, and the prototypes that I have seen were extremely promising. Of course I have personal favourites; the magically enfused Wizard set and the merciless Post Apocalyptic are all the rage. No matter what you choose however, it will satisfy your gaming needs.' Antonios S, RPG.net

 * With Goblin Coin Set unlocked, the Season 3 collector set already has 3 more coins added for free!

                            Since last year we have been working even closer with GamesQuest, one of the largest and most efficient European fullfilment houses and in such a complicated campaign we could not choose a better partner. With their experties in packing and shipping and the good communication we have built between us in the previous years, we are sure that you will receive your coins in time and without mistakes.
All packages are to be shipped from the GamesQuest's facilities in Alton, UK using Royal Mail and DHL.
Shipping is going to be charged in the pledge manager, after the campaign is over. You can see the final charges in the chart below;

Pledge Manager is a great platform that helps us receive get your address information as easy as possible.
Once more, we plan on using pledgemanager.com to make it easier for you to enter your address information and alter your pledge at the final moment.
*On the pledge manager VAT fees will be added to all applicable European countries.
Please share this campaign in your social media. The more people who see this campaign the more rewards we will be able to unlock for you giving not only more coins per set, but also more sets!  
    Track our project on Kicktraq!
                                                                     We are going to manufacture the coins once again in-house, following international standards and ensuring the best quality. We conduct daily quality control in our coins but we also offer replacements in any defective coin you might receive. After more than 4 full years of manufacturing the Legendary Metal Coins, we are now more than confident that you are going to love them, and that they are going to withstand the test of time.
We are passionate to bring the best to the gaming community worldwide. We have been manufacturing plastic and metal parts for games for the past years and we are more than happy for how well our previous Legendary Metal Coins campaign was received. We also have been heavy in designing and publishing our own games and line of accessories lately ;)  
Drawlab Entertainment: We are a boardgaming publishing company that also manufactures anything made of plastic or metal. Drawlab Entertainment was created through Kickstarter, after our first board game, Spells of Doom  was funded in 2014. Since then we have had 6 succesful Kickstarter campaigns funding both board games and board game accessories but continuing publishing games through traditional distribution.
Our most notable titles are When I Dream, Mystic ScROLLs, Project ELITE and our Legendary Metal Coins.
Michael Kontraros:“In many of the shows I have attended in the past two years, many people have been asking me if I would be willing to produce some of my figures, or if starting my own company was something I would consider. updates.update_userinfo: Final Fulfilment Update- Late pledges have now been shipped. New Legendary Metal Coins campaign announced.
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
We are glad to be reading again comments from people receiving their pledges. It's always rewarding seeing that people get their coins after months of hard work to make them perfect, especially with the hiccups we had shipping the final pledges of this project.
We are glad to announce that the late pledges were shipped on Friday.

Greetings dear backers,
we are happy that a great bunch of you have received your coins and we are thrilled to read your lovely posts. 

However, we are very concerned that a small percentage of you are not happy since you have still not received your coins. This is exactly what we have been working on it for the past few weeks. This update is about everyone who still has to receive their coins.

Winter is here and with him the holiday shipping season has started earlier than expected. The past couple of months we have faced several issues with multiple logistics partners that we use when shipping games and coins. These issues include delays in both picking up items and delivery times.
Even Gamesquest, our trusted fulfilment partner who is in charge of shipping out this campaign was affected by this situation, but since we delivered to them the coins a month in advance most of you received them in time.

However, we still have some backers that their pledge has not yet been shipped.
The , but were not included in the initial batch of sets to be shipped out. 

Unfortunately, right now Gamesquest cannot guarantee that the coins will all be shipped in time for you to have before Christmas. They are overwhelmed by work and even though they will try to make it happen, they have informed us that it doesn't seem likely. However, they informed us that by the 15th of January things will return to normality and they will be able to ship them out to you.
We have been thinking this over for the past weeks, and unfortunately, we feel our hands here are tied. Even though they are willing to ship the coins to someone else to fulfil the coins to you, it is a very complicated project that nobody else can guarantee to do it faster without any mistakes. Therefore, we have decided to wait for them to ship the coins. We always prefer a job well done over a hastily done one.
Even though there is a chance to ship them out during December, we expect them to be shipped between 5-15 of January.

It is not a situation we are happy with,since we have manufactured the coins and we will be more than happy when you will receive them. We remain steadily focused on making a quality product that makes people happy to game with, and after the coins are made we can hardly wait to see them in your hands. 

Finally, we had some super late backers, who completed the pledge manager outside the deadline. Their coins are being manufactured as we speak and will be shipped in 2019 for sure.

If you have any questions please let us know and will get back to you asap.
As you may have noticed we are responding to every single comment made in our campaign by mail and we will be even more active in the comment section these days.

~TL DR version: The coins are ready but after a shipping delay will be shipped in the next 30 days. ~

Happy holidays to all of you and many wishes from your friends at Drawlab :)

campaign.story:
For the first time in hundreds of years,
artist George Cochrane brings us a manuscript edition of Dante's masterpiece. We are excited to bring together this iconic text and the craftsmanship of the Medieval scribe and bookmaker. Allow us to introduce INFERNO.
Learn more about Dante's Inferno in this interview . . . 
This edition is unlike any you've ever seen. Not only is it printed letterpress and hand-bound, but each letter of each line has been written by hand, and each margin is lush with illustration.
In bringing together Dante and George Cochrane, each masters of their own craft, we hope to bring forward an edition of INFERNO unlike any which has ever existed. It is a manuscript edition (hand-lettered, hand-illustrated) which Dante would have found familiar, brought to life by the finest letterpress printing and hand binding. 
Allow us to introduce you to INFERNO, a letterpress printed and hand-bound book . . . 
We are proud to present 'Inferno'—in four magnificent versions.
Each binding offers something unique - check out the 'THREE BINDINGS' tier to get a copy of each!
A handmade book, through and through.
George has spent years hand-lettering this edition. The text is presented in both Italian and in English, and each margin illustrates the scene on the page. As he says, the lush illustrations give the reader a "visual gloss" as they follow Dante down into the depths. 
Each page was drawn completely by hand . . .
. . . with Dante's poetry hand-lettered, and marginal illustrations bringing each scene to life.
What is a 'fine press' book?
While most books are commercially mass-produced by machine, these are not. They are made by hand. When you add a Thornwillow fine press book to your collection, you can expect:
Each page to be printed letterpress. You can feel the impression of the type as you run your finger across the page.
Each book to be expertly hand-bound, using only the finest materials. 
Each book to be individually hand numbered.
And finally, when you pledge, your name is included on a subscribers list accompanying every book, and archived in the world's greatest collections.
Please enjoy this short film by our friends at Surrender Pictures about the Thornwillow philosophy   .   .   .
PLAY

What's different about this edition?
Friends of Thornwillow—those who have been collecting for years or who have just started—should know a few, exciting things which differentiate this edition from our past ones.
It is printed in two colors, in both red and black.
It is larger. While The Shakespeare Sonnets, Sherlock Holmes Hexalogy, Three War Stories, and Frankenstein were all roughly quarto size, this is printed in a folio format. (See the photos below for a comparison.)
The book has no typesetting—everything from the magnificent illustrations to the copyright page is in George's own hand.
INFERNO is the fifth edition we've brought to life with crowdfunding. We are offering two of the previous editions, THE SHAKESPEARE SONNETS and SHERLOCK HOLMES HEXALOGY alongside it.
PAPER-WRAPPER | $85. Edition size limited to one hundred more than backed.
Our paper-wrapper version is bound in a letterpress cover.
CLOTH | $185. Edition size limited to one hundred more than backed.
Our half-cloth version is bound in scarlet book cloth and letterpress board papers. The text is printed letterpress on heavy felt paper, with letterpress patterned endpapers.
HALF-LEATHER | Starting at $585. Only 66 copies available.
Our half-leather version is bound in scarlet Moroccan goatskin with handmade pastepaper. It comes in a suede-lined clamshell box with a leather spine label.
FULL-LEATHER | Starting at $1,500. Six versions available.
The Inferno centers on Dante, Virgil, and Beatrice. We are offering six copies of each in Full-Leather with their motifs gold tooled into the cover. Dante is bound in scarlet Morocco. Virgil is bound in Edwardian brown Morocco. Beatrice is bound in terracotta Morocco. 
Most spectacularly of all, we are offering three unique copies. When Dante reaches the bottom of Inferno, he finds the Devil three headed. The left head is black, the middle head is crimson, and the right head is yellow. Together, they are devouring Brutus, Cassius, and Judas Iscariot. We have crafted three monumental copies, representing the three heads, each set with gems in their eyes.
Moreover, each of these one-of-a-kind copies is printed on its own special paper stock and comes with an actual manuscript leaf by George Cochrane.
Most magnificently of all, the Middle Devil copy is also copiously hand-colored and extra illustrated by the artist. 
The Full-Leather bindings.
Each individual book is hand-bound at the press. Our master binders use the highest quality archival paper stock, book cloth and vegetable tanned Moroccan goatskin.
CLOTH and HALF-LEATHER copies are bound with Fleur-de-lis letterpress endpapers.

updates.update_content:
Dear friends, 
We are so pleased to announce our next book: Beauty is the Beginning of Terror.
This week marks the centennial of the end of the First World War. In remembrance of this international event, we have worked with the cadets and faculty of the U. S. Military Academy at West Point to put together an anthology of writings from The Great War unlike any which has ever existed. The book boasts twelve never-before-seen facsimile reproductions of artifacts from the War, and the introduction is written by General Martin E. Dempsey, who served as the highest U. S. military official, as President Obama's Chairman of the Joint Chiefs.

Friends,
Nearly every half-leather copy is out the door!  The feedback we've been receiving has been overwhelming.  THANK YOU.  Half-cloth copies have begun shipping; the bindery has been in full swing; half-cloth subscribers should be expecting their tracking codes soon.

As of October 2017, we are no longer a division of Osborne Coinage, though all of our coins are still produced in their facility in Cincinnati, Ohio (100% Made in the USA). They have a long history of producing coins with crisp detail out of pure materials that will withstand the test of time.

Our journey continues with this Kickstarter - while we are no longer employees of the mint, we still have their faith & support. Because we can no longer depend on their financial backing, we are not able to produce coins before successful crowdfunding.

Minting Process
Since we are no longer employees or a division of the mint, we no longer have insider access to behind the scenes & production. And while we are intimately familiar with the process, due to confidentiality agreements with our manufacturer we can only disclose so much of that process. As a private mint (the oldest in North America!), they have obvious reasons to keep trade practices confidential.
The basic manufacturing process starts in two different places: With the dies & the coin blanks. Both are made in house.
Kerry’s fine art and Miya’s reverse designs are translated into 3D by Master Sculptor, Randy Caskey, final materials are turned over to Osborne so that their engravers can cut the final production dies.
The coin blanks are punched from metal strip, on site at Osborne. They are washed & processed before they are ready to become a coin. Next is the “coining” process, the blanks & dies finally meet! The coin is struck only once using both dies. Most of our coins & all in the Forgotten Creatures line, are Antiqued. This is a complex process that involves multiple steps & accurate chemistry. The freshly struck coins are oxidized, buffed & lacquered. This creates the aged, ancient feel & brings out every line of detail in Kerry’s artwork.
Kerry & I proof each step of the way, ensuring we get an expertly detailed scene, die struck onto solid coin blanks that will withstand the test of time!
The creatures, people and lore depicted on our coins exist in a world plagued by an ancient magical corruption that is slowly breaking free of its primordial cage.
Ages ago a pair of fearless sovereigns sacrificed themselves to lock away this great corruption found deep beneath the forest.
Over the millennia their power has begun to wane and a foulness seeps up from the very earth, mutating everything in its path.
Few remain who know the secrets of the Foundry and the whispers of dark times to come. The guardians of the Foundry can no longer hold back the force that is corrupting the very fabric of our world, polluting minds and devastating the lands.
We’ve created a unique universe and are thrilled to share our take on classic myths and creatures. We hope you enjoy the tales we weave and the art we create. 
At it’s core Rare Elements Foundry is dedicated to melding fine art, design and craftsmanship to produce high quality coinage. But we also hope to tell a compelling story. Both with the coins themselves & the lore we develop. 
Look for our Adventure Prompt contests on FaceBook & follow our blog posts, which will explore the myths, legends and lore we have created. Our coins can be used with any campaign or adventure, but we hope you will enjoy & be inspired by what we have created!

Our close proximity to, as well as, our relationship and history with the mint minimizes any challenges or risks associated with producing coins for us (& you).

Miya is a 10 year veteran of the coin industry. Kerry has studied under Masters in sculpture, lithography & etching; has earned a Bachelors Degree in Fine Art, and her work has been featured in multiple gallery exhibitions.   There are three classes of people: those who see, those who see when they are shown and those who do not see.
The CRYPTEX is a mysterious artifact inspired on Leonardo DaVinci's work, first mentioned in 2003 on the best selling book The Da Vinci Code by Dan Brown. It is a mechanical lock artifact with a secret chamber inside.
We are introducing a redesigned and engineered version of this artifact. A beautiful and affordable product with endless possibilities. We are proud to share we issued a patent of our design, it is now patent pending. 
MXN $460  ≈  USD $24 
Create, design and solve enigmas, riddles and cryptograms.
Hide secret messages, store your most valuable items, make surprises, create challenging adventures. 
  Watch the story of this young adventurer on his way to find the treasure...
Beautifully wood-crafted using CNC technology with details and finishes by hand.
Six digits, one password. Six decagonal rings with engraved numbers on the surface. 1,000,000 possible combinations. Smooth ratchet mechanisms inside each ring.   
Inspired on DaVinci's inventions. DaVinci must be proud!
Inside...
A secret chamber with 26.5cm3 (1.616 in3) of volume capacity. Here you can store anything you want!
  It only opens when you put the right combination.
The Cryptex is completely developed and it is ready to be manufactured. It took us several months to develop it as a product and make each little detail perfect. The mechanism, the material, its resistance and durability, how pieces join together, its shape and weight. It was carefully designed and engineered to ensure the best user experience for all ages.
Achievement unlocked - Customize it!
We'll let you decide what to engrave in this area of your Cryptex!
Check the new design from the image below
We know how customized things are way more unique and full of meaning for each of us. This is why we'll be able to customize it with your own personal touch to make it perfect for you.
New design
We are featuring the DaVinci's phrase we love. This phrase to continues to inspire us to innovate and create things differently. A meaningful phrase simulating DaVinci's hand-written Italian.   
Ci sono tre tipi di persone: quelli che vedono, quelli che vedono quando viene mostrato, e quelli che non lo vedono.

campaign.story:
There’s gold in the Black Hills of South Dakota, and you’ve come to find (or steal) your share. You’re staying at one of the three major establishments in Deadwood where you and your associates are working together to steal some of the gold-filled safes floating around town. But you suspect that the “friends” you’re working with are secretly plotting to keep all the gold for themselves. Will you be ready to turn on them before they shoot you in the back?
Deadwood 1876 is a social deduction game where you'll work with teammates to find and collect gold. But in the end, the team with the most gold will have to fight each other to the death to determine the winner! Will you spend your turns helping your team find gold, or preparing to defeat your own teammates in the Final Showdown?
2-9 Players. 20-40 minutes. Ages 13+.
1 Magnetic book box
1 Faux leather pouch
1 Rulebook (includes character biographies and Deadwood history)
3 Wood carved platforms
9 Wood star pawns
10 Wood engraved dice
79 cards (9 Characters, 20 Safes, 50 Deadwood)
The game comes in a magnetically-closing faux book. Extra room is provided in the center section should you desire to sleeve the cards.
The wood establishment platforms conjure the look of an old western storefront. Since each platform is stained and laser cut, the wood grain and color will be slightly unique in each copy of the game. The platforms are laser cut in the negative space, so each letter and design comes outwards.
The ten wooden dice each use custom designs instead of standard dots. Each colored dice corresponds to a gun in the game and has different values depending on the gun. Each die is colored and engraved.
 Nine wooden stars act as the pawns in the game.
 The dice and stars come in a faux leather bag.
The 9 characters are based on people who actually lived in or visited Deadwood in 1876. Character biographies are included in the rule book. Each character card is colored on the front, and black and white on the back.
The 20 Safe cards are designed to look like genuine safes from the 1870's.
Each of the 50 Deadwood cards contains a gun on top and a special item on the bottom.
In Deadwood 1876 you’ll use cards from your hand to try to win Safes from other players. Safes contain Badges, Gold, or Showdown Guns. Near the end of the game, players with Badges get extra turns. After the final turn, the team with the most Gold will advance to the Final Showdown. There, teammates will have to fight each other to the death using Showdown Guns. The last person alive is the winner!
Note: The video above gives a brief overview of rules. Strategy tips, rule clarifications, advanced optional rules, card descriptions, and character biographies are all included in the game rule book. We currently have rules available to view in English, German, French, Italian, Spanish and Dutch on our website. You can also view the contents of this page in Chinese.
Valuable items are hidden behind each Safe. You won't know which Safes have been shuffled in, so every round will play out differently.
Each player always has 4 Deadwood cards in their hand. You'll get to play one card from your hand each turn, and then it will be replaced from the deck.
Each card can either be used as the gun listed on top, or the special item listed on the bottom. The Holster lets you help out teammates, the Stetson lets you view hidden Safes, the Horse lets you abandon your team for a different one, and the Duster lets you improve your hand of cards.
The more powerful guns, such as the Messenger, have higher values on its dice, whereas worse guns, such as the Pepperbox, have lower values and zeros on its dice.  For shootouts you'll need to manage your hand and decide when to use a powerful gun and when to gamble with your weaker guns.
Each player takes on the identity of one of nine people who actually roamed the streets of Deadwood.
A game in progress.
This game requires teamwork, but also actively punishes you if you play too nice. That balance makes every round insane. - Sam J.
Mix strategy with the best and the worst of the Wild West, and you get Deadwood. - Charlotte C.
The strategy never gets old and I consistently find myself playing with new options every single game. -Spencer H.
Backstabbing has never been so much fun. This game keeps you on your toes. It is not one you can play half-heartedly. -Abigail S.
The more I play Deadwood, the less likely I am to trust other players. When I trust them too much, they take my gold and shoot me with a gun they stole from me. I always regret it. -Patti S.
Intrigues of Deadwood 1876 video from Beasts of War.
A great game (in our opinion), needs three things: solid mechanics, an awesome theme, and beautiful design.
Mechanics
Deadwood is a balance between teamwork and selfishness. If a player uses all of their best Deadwood cards and Badges to hunt down Gold for their team, they’ll be defenseless to fight against their teammates in the Final Showdown. But if a player only goes after Showdown Guns and saves all of their best cards, their team might not have enough Gold to actually reach the Final Showdown. If someone on your team doesn’t seem to be pulling their weight, they’re probably plotting to use your Gold to reach the Final Showdown and then destroy you! There may come a point when you need to attack, mislead, frame, abandon, or banish your own teammates.
Theme
When we were searching for the city for the 3rd Volume in the Dark Cities Series, we fell in love with Deadwood almost immediately upon learning about it. Large deposits of gold were discovered in the Black Hills of South Dakota in late 1875. Word quickly spread about the gold and the town of Deadwood was born almost overnight in early 1876. It soon reached a population of 5,000 miners, gamblers, prostitutes, outlaws, and businessmen. Lawlessness was prevalent as people flocked to the town to find (or steal) their share of the gold. Deadwood quickly became an infamous western town where old west legends lived and died.
The book has a raised UV effect so that all designs and logos pop out from the cover and spine.
Design
The illustrations from Sarah Keele and graphic design from Holly Hancock take players into the world of the wild wild west! We used wood and leather textures with our components, old west Victorian charm with our book and character cards, and cards that look like antiqued metal Safes built by the "Facade Safe & Lock Co" similar to Safes from the time period. The goal of our design is to take you and your friends deep into the raucous, chaotic, exciting world of Deadwood, South Dakota in its prime. You can view time-lapse videos of Sarah illustrating Molly Johnson, Solomon Star, Seth Bullock, Kitty Leroy, and the Holster.
We've already made many "premium" choices for the game (wooden platforms instead of cardboard, faux leather bag instead of plastic, wooden star tokens instead of standard pawns, faux book instead of standard box, etc.), because we believe in publishing awesome games regardless of funding amounts. But if we reach the following milestones, we'll be able to make Deadwood 1876 even better!
Note: Some of these upgrades will be exclusive to the 1st Edition of Deadwood 1876. Backing on Kickstarter is the only way to guarantee that all upgrades listed above will be included in your copy of the game.
We've been working hard on logistics all year and for this campaign we're very pleased to offer free US shipping at all reward levels, and low international shipping rates. We are also using fulfillment companies around the world so that you won't be charged extra customs fees. If you are mistakenly charged customs fees when the games arrive, just let us know and we'll pay you back. (For EU backers, we will be shipping games from Germany so you won't have extra customs fees)
Because of cheaper shipping, we’re happy to be selling Deadwood 1876 at prices that are even cheaper than the early bird levels of our previous two Kickstarter projects!
Deadwood 1876 is Volume 3 in the Dark Cities Series! Each Volume is a stand-alone game that comes in the same sized faux book box, focuses on a particular city and year, and includes a dark or mysterious element in its game play. 
Volume 1: Tortuga 1667 (Published 2017 thanks to Kickstarter!). Click the links to view the original Kickstarter campaign or our website. Tortuga was recently nominated as the best party game of 2017 by Board Game Geek!
Volume 2: Salem 1692 (Published as "Salem" in 2015 thanks to Kickstarter! Second edition published as "Salem 1692" in 2017). Click the links to view the original Kickstarter campaign or our website.
Both of our released games have sold over 20,000 copies and are now played around the world! We're already hard at work on Volume 4, and we will continue expanding the series. We know your game closet is a mess. Start your bookshelf collection of games with the Dark Cities Series! See Add-Ons section below for details.
If your pledge includes at least one copy of Deadwood 1876 then you can add an unlimited amount of Tortuga 1667, Salem 1692, or extra copies of Deadwood 1876 to your pledge! Just add the indicated amounts below to your pledge amount without changing your reward level. After the campaign we'll send out a survey where you'll select which games you'd like to be added to your order based on how much extra money you pledged. If you have any questions, please see the FAQ section or shoot us a message.
Your shipping cost does not increase at all regardless of your location or the amount of add-ons you order. You will receive all add-on items at the same time that all of the Kickstarter rewards are received (estimated delivery October 2018).
 Examples:
You are outside the US and want 2 copies of each game. Select the $43 reward level and pledge $129 ($43 two-copies reward level + $6 reward level int'l shipping + $40 two add-ons of Salem + $40 two add-ons of Tortuga).
You are in the US and want 6 copies of Deadwood, 1 copy of Salem, and 10 copies of Tortuga. Select the $110 reward level and pledge $300 ($110 six-copies reward level  + $20 Salem add-on + $170 Tortuga large group add-on). 
If you want Deadwood and Salem, Deadwood and Tortuga, or one of each game, we have reward levels available for those options.
Our illustrator Sarah Keele wants to turn you into a Dark Cities character! During the campaign Sarah is offering a limited number of discounted custom portraits in her shop! We will then turn this portrait into a card that you'll be able to use during game play in your copy of Deadwood 1876!
Custom Character Cards are also available in her shop for Tortuga 1667 and Salem 1692. Discounts are also available in her shop during the campaign for other art from the game.
Follow her instagram for other giveaways and discounts.
We will send a survey to the email associated with your Kickstarter account on April 10th using the CrowdOx pledge manager system. You will be able to choose your add-on orders and provide your shipping information at that time. If you change addresses before we ship your rewards, you will be able to access your survey at this link anytime after April 10th: https://app.crowdox.com/retrieve/travishancock/deadwood-1876-a-safe-robbing-game-of-teamwork-and
Game creation and graphic design is by Facade Games, owned and operated by Travis and Holly Hancock (and our little cheerleader Margo). Learn more at www.facadegames.com, or follow us on facebook, instagram, or twitter.
Illustrations were drawn by Sarah Keele. Follow her beautiful artwork on instagram.
Photography was by Jes Childress. See more of her pictures at her website. 
A huge thank you to the hundreds of hours put in by our many play-testers. This game would not exist without your ideas, feedback, and criticisms. Thank you!
We fell in love with the Kickstarter community when we launched our first game, Salem. We had another great experience with the launch of our second game, Tortuga 1667. The feedback, support, trust, and positivity from the community was incredible. We're proud to reward our Kickstarter backers with discounts on the very 1st edition of the game, the lowest shipping costs we can offer, first-in-line knowledge and insight into the project, and a direct line of communication to us as the creators. campaign.story:
Vastarien. The forbidden tome. The impossible otherworld. A textual entryway into
"...a place where everything was transfixed in the order of the unreal. . . . Each passage he entered in the book both enchanted and appalled him with images and incidents so freakish and chaotic that his usual sense of these terms disintegrated along with everything else. Rampant oddity seemed to be the rule of the realm; imperfection became the source of the miraculous — wonders of deformity and marvels of miscreation. There was horror, undoubtedly. But it was a horror uncompromised by any feeling of lost joy or thwarted redemption; rather, it was a deliverance by damnation. And if Vastarien was a nightmare, it was a nightmare transformed in spirit by the utter absence of refuge: nightmare made normal."
Our name is drawn from Thomas Ligotti’s classic story of the same title (quoted above). Vastarien is a source of critical study and creative response to the corpus of Thomas Ligotti as well as associated authors and ideas. The inaugural issue is going to be something unusually special, filled with in-depth essays, interviews, weird fiction, terrific poetry, and fascinating hybrid pieces by some of the best authors out there.  An interview with Thomas Ligotti and an introduction by him, neither of which have ever been presented in English, are included. 
And we are open for submissions for issues 2 and 3 right now.
All galley proofs for Issue 1 have been approved. Final cover art is by the incomparable Dave Felton for the inaugural issue of Vastarien. We're only waiting to make it available upon the successful completion of this Kickstarter campaign, which will cover our costs for issues 1-3 and set the foundation for its continuing publication in 2019 and beyond. 
    Art by Dave Felton
As a journal, our interests include but are not limited to the following subjects:
Supernatural horror (both fiction and film)
Philosophical pessimism
Gnosticism
Buddhism
Nihilism
Surrealism
Decadent and fin de siècle literature

Risks and challenges
Issue 1 is ready for publication now -- it is formatted and ready to be published as soon as production costs and fees are met. The Kickstarter campaign will cover our costs and, hopefully, help pay for future issues (and a payment upgrade for our wonderful authors and artists). 

Any new literary endeavor risks failing due to lack of interest or editorial life changes, but we feel that a journal like VASTARIEN has a tremendously solid foundation. Matt Cardin and Jon Padgett, the Co-Editors-in-Chief, have been producing and editing content about and/or inspired by Thomas Ligotti for over twenty years now, and it is doubtful that either will cease any time soon. Notably, VASTARIEN is the first project of the fledgling Grimscribe Press, which plans to produce Ligottian content -- fiction, nonfiction, poetry, visual art, and hybrid pieces -- for many years to come.
